Vr̥ṣasārasaṁgrahaḥ

वृषसारसंग्रहः

[ prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ प्रथमो ऽध्यायः ] [ stutiḥ ] [ स्तुतिः ]
anādimadhyāntam anantapāraṁ अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तपारं
1a °ntam ananta° C94C45pcC02K82K10K07K03ME; °ntam anta° C45ac •
 १ a: °न्तमनन्त° C94C45pcC02K82K10K07K03ME; °न्तमन्त° C45ac •
 °pāraṁ CK07ME; °pāragaṁ K82K10K03
 °पारं CK07ME; °पारगं K82K10K03
 ------------------ 1a cf. SDHU 10.6: ādimadhyāntanirmuktaḥ svabhāvavimalaḥ prabhuḥ | sarvajñaḥ paripūrṇaś ca śivo jñeyaḥ śivāgame ||
     susūkṣmam avyaktajagatsusāram |     सुसूक्ष्ममव्यक्तजगत्सुसारम् ।
1b susūkṣma° C94C45K82K10K07K03ME; śusukṣma° C02 •
 १ b: सुसूक्ष्म° C94C45K82K10K07K03ME; शुसुक्ष्म° C02 •
 °jagatsusāram C94C45K82K07ME; °jagaśusāraṁ C02, °jagatsurāsuraṁ K10, °जगत्सुसारम् C94C45K82K07ME; °जगशुसारं C02, °जगत्सुरासुरं K10, °jagatasusāram K03
 °जगतसुसारम् K03
harīndrabrahmādibhir āsamagraṁ हरीन्द्रब्रह्मादिभिरासमग्रं
1c °bhir āsamagraṁ CK82K10K07K03E; १ c: °भिरासमग्रं CK82K10K07K03E; °bhir yat samagraṁ M (unmetrical)
 °भिर्यत्समग्रं M (unmetrical)
     praṇamya vakṣye vr̥ṣasārasaṁgraham ||1.1||     प्रणम्य वक्ष्ये वृषसारसंग्रहम् ॥१:१
1d vr̥ṣa° C94pcC45C02K82K10K07K03ME; °vr̥ṣo C94ac
 १ d: वृष° C94pcC45C02K82K10K07K03ME; °वृषो C94ac
 ------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 193v–195v, C45 ff. 201v–203v, C02 ff. 267r–270r, K82 ff. 1v–3v, K10 exp. 44, 43 lower and then upper leaf; (1.62cd–2.22 are missing), K07 ff. 209v–211v, K03 ff. 227v–229v (collated only up to 1.15ab), M ff. 1r–3v, E pp. 580–585; C = C94 + C45 + C02
[ janamejayavaiśampāyanasaṁvādaḥ ] [ जनमेजयवैशम्पायनसंवादः ]
śatasāhasrikaṁ granthaṁ sahasrādhyāyam uttamam | शतसाहस्रिकं ग्रन्थं सहस्राध्यायमुत्तमम् ।
2b sahasrādhyāyam u° C94C45K82K10K07K03M; sahaśradhyāyam u° C02, २ b: सहस्राध्यायमु° C94C45K82K10K07K03M; सहश्रध्यायमु° C02, sahasrādhyāyar u° E
 सहस्राध्यायरु° E
parva cāsya śataṁ pūrṇaṁ śrutvā bhāratasaṁhitām ||1.2|| पर्व चास्य शतं पूर्णं श्रुत्वा भारतसंहिताम् ॥१:२
2c parva cāsya C94K82K10K07M; parvañ cāsya C45, २ c: पर्व चास्य C94K82K10K07M; पर्वञ्चास्य C45, parvam asya C02K03ME •
 पर्वमस्य C02K03ME •

 2d śrutvā C94C02K82K10K07K03ME; śraddhā C45 •
 २ d: श्रुत्वा C94C02K82K10K07K03ME; श्रद्धा C45 •

 ------------------ 2c cf. MBH 1.2.70ab: etat parvaśataṁ pūrṇaṁ vyāsenoktaṁ mahātmanā
atr̥ptaḥ puna papraccha vaiśampāyanam eva hi | अतृप्तः पुन पप्रच्छ वैशम्पायनमेव हि ।
3a atr̥ptaḥ puna papraccha em.; ३ a: अतृप्तः पुन पप्रच्छ em.; a≀tr̥ptaḥ pu≀**praccha C94, अ≀तृप्तः पु≀**प्रच्छ C94, atr̥ptaḥ punaḥ papraccha C45K82K10K07, अतृप्तः पुनः पप्रच्छ C45K82K10K07, atr̥ptaḥ punar apracche C02, अतृप्तः पुनरप्रच्छे C02, atr̥ptaḥ puna paḥpraccha K03, अतृप्तः पुन पःप्रच्छ K03, atr̥ptaḥ punaḥ papr̥ccha M, अतृप्तः पुनः पपृच्छ M, atr̥ptā punaḥ papraccha E

janamejaya yat pūrvaṁ tac chr̥ṇu tvam atandritaḥ ||1.3|| जनमेजय यत्पूर्वं तच्छृणु त्वमतन्द्रितः ॥१:३

janamejaya uvāca | जनमेजय उवाच ।

bhagavan sarvadharmajña sarvaśāstraviśārada | भगवन्सर्वधर्मज्ञ सर्वशास्त्रविशारद ।
4a bhagavan sa° C94C45K82K10K07E; bhacāvaṁ sa° C02, bhagava sa° K03, ४ a: भगवन्स° C94C45K82K10K07E; भचावं स° C02, भगव स° K03, bhagavaṁ sa° M •

 ------------------ 4ab = MBH 13.112.9ab
asti dharmaṁ paraṁ guhyaṁ saṁsārārṇavatāraṇam ||1.4|| अस्ति धर्मं परं गुह्यं संसारार्णवतारणम् ॥१:४
4c asti dharmaṁ C94K82K10K07E; asti dharmaḥ C45, asti dharma C02M, adharma K03 •
 ४ c: अस्ति धर्मं C94K82K10K07E; अस्ति धर्मः C45, अस्ति धर्म C02M, अधर्म K03 •

dvaipāyanamukhodgīrṇaṁ dharmaṁ vā yad dvijottama | द्वैपायनमुखोद्गीर्णं धर्मं वा यद्द्विजोत्तम ।
5a dvaipāyana° C94C45K82K10K07K03ME; dvepāyana° C02 •

kathayasva hi me tr̥ptiṁ kuru yatnāt tapodhana ||1.5|| कथयस्व हि मे तृप्तिं कुरु यत्नात्तपोधन ॥१:५

śīlaśaucasamācāraṁ sarvabhūtadayāparam ||1.7|| शीलशौचसमाचारं सर्वभूतदयापरम् ॥१:७

[vigatarāga uvāca | ] [विगतराग उवाच ।]
brahmavidyā kathaṁ jñeyā rūpavarṇavivarjitā | ब्रह्मविद्या कथं ज्ञेया रूपवर्णविवर्जिता ।

anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
anuccāryam asandigdham avicchinnam anākulam | अनुच्चार्यमसन्दिग्धमविच्छिन्नमनाकुलम् ।
10a °ccārya° C94C45K82K10ME; °cārya° C02K07K03

[ kālapāśaḥ ] [ कालपाशः ]

11 °rāga uvāca CK82K10K07ME; °rāgovāca K03

dehī dehe kṣayaṁ yāte bhūjalāgniśivādibhiḥ | देही देहे क्षयं याते भूजलाग्निशिवादिभिः ।

paryāyeṇa tu vakṣyāmi yathāśakyaṁ dvijottama | पर्यायेण तु वक्ष्यामि यथाशक्यं द्विजोत्तम ।

 ------------------ 39cd cf. BRAHMANDAPUR 3.4.58cd: brahmā dadau śāstram idaṁ purāṇaṁ mātariśvane

[ bhūbhr̥tāṁ nāmāni ] [ भूभृतां नामानि ] [ pūrvataḥ ] [ पूर्वतः ]

vāyunā pāda saṁkṣipya prāptaṁ cośanasaṁ purā | वायुना पाद संक्षिप्य प्राप्तं चोशनसं पुरा ।
64a saṁkṣipya CK82K07E; saṁkṣipyaḥ M
 ६४ a: संक्षिप्य CK82K07E; संक्षिप्यः M

br̥haspatis tu provāca sūryaṁ triṁśatsahasrikam | बृहस्पतिस्तु प्रोवाच सूर्यं त्रिंशत्सहस्रिकम् ।

|| iti vr̥ṣasārasaṁgrahe brahmāṇḍasaṁkhyā nāmādhyāyaḥ prathamaḥ || इति वृषसारसंग्रहे ब्रह्माण्डसंख्या नामाध्यायः प्रथमः ॥
Colophon: nāmādhyāyaḥ prathamaḥ CK82K07; nāmādhyāyaḥ prathamaḥ śloka 77 M, Colophon: नामाध्यायः प्रथमः CK82K07; नामाध्यायः प्रथमः श्लोक ७७ M, nāma prathamo 'dhyāya E
 नाम प्रथमो ऽध्याय E



[ dvitīyo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ द्वितीयो ऽध्यायः ]
vigatarāga uvāca | विगतराग उवाच ।
śrutaṁ mayā janāgreṇa brahmāṇḍasya tu nirṇayam | श्रुतं मया जनाग्रेण ब्रह्माण्डस्य तु निर्णयम् ।
1a janāgreṇa C45C02K82K07E; janā×× C94
 १ a: जनाग्रेण C45C02K82K07E; जना×× C94
pramāṇaṁ varṇarūpaṁ ca saṁkhyā tasya samāsataḥ ||2.1|| प्रमाणं वर्णरूपं च संख्या तस्य समासतः ॥२:१
------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 195v–197r, C45 ff. 203v–204v, C02 ff. 270r–270v (it breaks off at 2.21 and resumes at 3.30b), K82 ff. 3v–4v, K10 exp. 43 and 42 (sic!; it broke off at 1.62d and resumes at 2.23), K07 ff. 211v–213r; E pp. 585–588; C = C94 + C45 + C02
śivāṇḍeti tvayā prokto brahmāṇḍālayakīrtitaḥ | शिवाण्डेति त्वया प्रोक्तो ब्रह्माण्डालयकीर्तितः ।
2b brahmāṇḍā° CK82K07; brahmāṇḍa E
 २ b: ब्रह्माण्डा° CK82K07; ब्रह्माण्ड E
kīdr̥śaṁ lakṣaṇaṁ jñeyaṁ pramāṇaṁ tasya vā kati ||2.2|| कीदृशं लक्षणं ज्ञेयं प्रमाणं तस्य वा कति ॥२:२
2c jñeyaṁ C94C45K82K07E; jñeyā C02
 २ c: ज्ञेयं C94C45K82K07E; ज्ञेया C02
 2d kati C94C45K82K07E; katiḥ C02
 २ d: कति C94C45K82K07E; कतिः C02
kasya vā layanaṁ jñeyaṁ pramāṇaṁ vātra vāsinaḥ | कस्य वा लयनं ज्ञेयं प्रमाणं वात्र वासिनः ।
3a layanaṁ jñeyaṁ C94C02K82K07; layanaṁ C45, lakṣaṇaṁ jñeyaṁ E

 ३ b: वासिनः C94C02K82K07E; वासिरानः C45
kā vā tatra prajā jñeyā ko vā tatra prajāpatiḥ ||2.3|| का वा तत्र प्रजा ज्ञेया को वा तत्र प्रजापतिः ॥२:३

[ śivāṇḍasaṁkhyā ] [ शिवाण्डसंख्या ]
anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
śivāṇḍalakṣaṇaṁ vipra na tvaṁ praṣṭum ihārhasi | शिवाण्डलक्षणं विप्र न त्वं प्रष्टुमिहार्हसि ।
4b na tvaṁ CK82K07; tatvaṁ E •
 ४ b: न त्वं CK82K07; तत्वं E •

daivatair api kā śaktir jñātuṁ draṣṭuṁ ca tattvataḥ ||2.4|| दैवतैरपि का शक्तिर्ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वतः ॥२:४

agamyagamanaṁ guhyaṁ guhyād api samuddhr̥tam | अगम्यगमनं गुह्यं गुह्यादपि समुद्धृतम् ।

 ------------------ 5ab cf. LINPU 1.21.71ab: namo guṇyāya guhyāya agamyagamanāya ca
na prabhur netaras tatra na daṇḍyo na ca daṇḍakaḥ ||2.5|| न प्रभुर्नेतरस्तत्र न दण्ड्यो न च दण्डकः ॥२:५

nādhamaḥ puruṣas tatra nottamo na ca madhyamaḥ ||2.8|| नाधमः पुरुषस्तत्र नोत्तमो न च मध्यमः ॥२:८
notkr̥ṣṭo mānavas tasmin striyaś caiva śivālaye | नोत्कृष्टो मानवस्तस्मिन्स्त्रियश्चैव शिवालये ।

tasyeśānasya devasya aiśvaryaguṇavistaram | तस्येशानस्य देवस्य ऐश्वर्यगुणविस्तरम् ।

tatra vipra prajāḥ sarve anantaguṇasāgarāḥ | तत्र विप्र प्रजाः सर्वे अनन्तगुणसागराः ।
tulyarūpabalāḥ sarve sūryāyutasamaprabhāḥ ||2.22|| तुल्यरूपबलाः सर्वे सूर्यायुतसमप्रभाः ॥२:२२

parārdhadvayavistāraṁ parārdhadvayam āyatam | परार्धद्वयविस्तारं परार्धद्वयमायतम् ।
parārdhadvayavikṣepā yojanānāṁ dvijottama ||2.23|| परार्धद्वयविक्षेपा योजनानां द्विजोत्तम ॥२:२३

aiśvaryatvaṁ na saṁkhyāsti balaśaktiś ca bho dvija | ऐश्वर्यत्वं न संख्यास्ति बलशक्तिश्च भो द्विज ।
24b balaśaktiś ca bho dvija C94C45K82pcK10K07; २४ b: बलशक्तिश्च भो द्विज C94C45K82pcK10K07; omitted in K82ac, tava śaktiś ca bho dvija E

adhordhvo na ca saṁkhyāsti na tiryañ caiti kaścana ||2.24|| अधोर्ध्वो न च संख्यास्ति न तिर्यञ्चैति कश्चन ॥२:२४
24c adhordhvo na ca saṁkhyāsti C94C45K82pcK10K07E; omitted in K82ac
 २४ c: अधोर्ध्वो न च संख्यास्ति C94C45K82pcK10K07E; omitted in K82ac
 24d na tiryañ caiti kaścana K82pcK07; २४ d: न तिर्यञ्चैति कश्चन K82pcK07; na tiryañ ceti kaścana C94C45K10E, न तिर्यञ्चेति कश्चन C94C45K10E, na tiryaṁ ceti kaścana K82ac
 न तिर्यं चेति कश्चन K82ac
śivāṇḍasya ca vistāram āyāmaṁ ca na vedmy aham | शिवाण्डस्य च विस्तारमायामं च न वेद्म्यहम् ।
bhogam akṣaya tatraiva janmamr̥tyur na vidyate ||2.25|| भोगमक्षय तत्रैव जन्ममृत्युर्न विद्यते ॥२:२५
25c bhogam akṣaya ta° em.; bhogam akṣayas ta° C94C45K82K10K07 (unmetrical), २५ c: भोगमक्षय त° em.; भोगमक्षयस्त° C94C45K82K10K07 (unmetrical), bhogamayās tu ta° E

śivāṇḍamadhyam āśritya gokṣīrasadr̥śaprabhāḥ | शिवाण्डमध्यमाश्रित्य गोक्षीरसदृशप्रभाः ।

dattvā vā vedaviduṣe śraddhābhaktisamanvitaḥ | दत्त्वा वा वेदविदुषे श्रद्धाभक्तिसमन्वितः ।

40b dharmo C94C45K82K10E; dharme K07

alātacakravat sarvaṁ kālo yāti paribhraman | अलातचक्रवत्सर्वं कालो याति परिभ्रमन् ।
traikālyakalanāt kālas tena kālaḥ prakīrtitaḥ ||2.40|| त्रैकाल्यकलनात्कालस्तेन कालः प्रकीर्तितः ॥२:४०

|| iti vr̥ṣasārasaṁgrahe śivāṇḍasaṁkhyā nāmādhyāyo dvitīyaḥ || इति वृषसारसंग्रहे शिवाण्डसंख्या नामाध्यायो द्वितीयः ॥

[ tr̥tīyo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ तृतीयो ऽध्यायः ] [ dharmapravacanam ] [ धर्मप्रवचनम् ]
vigatarāga uvāca | विगतराग उवाच ।
kimarthaṁ dharmam ity āhuḥ katimūrtiś ca kīrtyate | किमर्थं धर्ममित्याहुः कतिमूर्तिश्च कीर्त्यते ।
1a āhuḥ PC94C45K82K10K07; āhu E
 १ a: आहुः PC94C45K82K10K07; आहु E
 ------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: P exp. 215r–215v (breaks off after 3.14d and resumes at 4.8a), C94 ff. 197r–198v, C45 ff. 204v–206r, C02 ff. 273r–273v (broke off at 2.21 and resumes at 3.30b), K82 ff. 4v–6r, K10 exp. 42, 47 (upper), 48 (lower), K07 ff. 213r–214v, E pp. 588–591; C = C94 + C45 + C02
katipādavr̥ṣo jñeyo gatis tasya kati smr̥tāḥ ||3.1|| कतिपादवृषो ज्ञेयो गतिस्तस्य कति स्मृताः ॥३:१
1d smr̥tāḥ PC94K82K10K07; smr̥tā C45, smr̥taḥ E
 १ d: स्मृताः PC94K82K10K07; स्मृता C45, स्मृतः E
kautūhalaṁ mamotpannaṁ saṁśayaṁ chindhi tattvataḥ | कौतूहलं ममोत्पन्नं संशयं छिन्धि तत्त्वतः ।
2a kautūhalaṁ PC94C45K82K10K07; kautuhala E •
 २ a: कौतूहलं PC94C45K82K10K07; कौतुहल E •

 2b saṁśayaṁ PC45K82K10K07E; saśayaṁ C94
 २ b: संशयं PC45K82K10K07E; सशयं C94
kasya putro muniśreṣṭha prajās tasya kati smr̥tāḥ ||3.2|| कस्य पुत्रो मुनिश्रेष्ठ प्रजास्तस्य कति स्मृताः ॥३:२
anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
dhr̥tir ity eṣa dhātur vai paryāyaḥ parikīrtitaḥ | धृतिरित्येष धातुर्वै पर्यायः परिकीर्तितः ।
ādhāraṇān mahattvāc ca dharma ity abhidhīyate ||3.3|| आधारणान्महत्त्वाच्च धर्म इत्यभिधीयते ॥३:३
3c ādhāraṇān ma° PC94K10; ādhāraṇāt pa° C45, ādhāraṇāt ma° K82K07, ādhāreṇa ma° E

 ------------------ 3cd cf. LINPU 1.10.12cd–13ab: dhāraṇārthe mahān hy eṣa dharmaśabdaḥ prakīrtitaḥ || adhāraṇe 'mahattve ca adharma iti cocyate | 3 cf. BRAHMANDAPUR 1.32.29: dhāraṇārtho dhr̥tiś caiva dhātuḥ śabde prakīrtitaḥ | adhāraṇāmahattve ca adharma iti cocyate ||; cf. VAYUP 1.59.28: dhāraṇā dhr̥tir ity arthād dhātor dharmaḥ prakīrtitaḥ | adhāraṇe 'mahattve ca adharma iti cocyate ||; ≈ MATSP 145.27: dharmeti dhāraṇe dhātur mahatve caiva ucyate| ādhāraṇe mahattve vā dharmaḥ sa tu nirucyate|
śrutismr̥tidvayor mūrtiś catuṣpādavr̥ṣaḥ sthitaḥ | श्रुतिस्मृतिद्वयोर्मूर्तिश्चतुष्पादवृषः स्थितः ।

caturāśrama yo dharmaḥ kīrtitāni manīṣibhiḥ ||3.4|| चतुराश्रम यो धर्मः कीर्तितानि मनीषिभिः ॥३:४

gatiś ca pañca vijñeyāḥ śr̥ṇu dharmasya bho dvija | गतिश्च पञ्च विज्ञेयाः शृणु धर्मस्य भो द्विज ।

------------------ 10 For 3.10–13, see a rather similar passage e.g. in KURMP 1.8.20 ff.: śraddhāyā ātmajaḥ kāmo darpo lakṣmīsutaḥ smr̥taḥ | dhr̥tyās tu niyamaḥ putras tuṣṭyāḥ saṁtoṣa ucyate || puṣṭyā lābhaḥ sutaś cāpi medhāputraḥ śrutas tathā | kriyāyāś cābhavat putro daṇḍaḥ samaya eva ca || buddhyā bodhaḥ sutas tadvad apramādo vyajāyata | lajjāyā vinayaḥ putro vapuṣo vyavasāyakaḥ || kṣemaḥ śāntisutaś cāpi sukhaṁ siddhir ajāyata | yaśaḥ kīrtisutas tadvad ity ete dharmasūnavaḥ || kāmasya harṣaḥ putro 'bhūd devānando vyajāyata | ity eṣa vai sukhodarkaḥ sargo dharmasya kīrtitaḥ ||
puṣṭyā lābhaḥ suto jāto medhāputraḥ śrutas tathā | पुष्ट्या लाभः सुतो जातो मेधापुत्रः श्रुतस्तथा ।

 ------------------ 14c In P, folio 215v ends with kautūhalam atī and the next available folio side (217r) starts with tyam iṣṭagatiḥ proktaṁ in 4.8a. Thus one folio (f. 216), containing 3.14d–4.7, is missing.
anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
śrutismr̥tidvayor mūrtir dharmasya parikīrtitā | श्रुतिस्मृतिद्वयोर्मूर्तिर्धर्मस्य परिकीर्तिता ।
15a śruti° C94K82K10K07; śrutiḥ C45E
 १५ a: श्रुति° C94K82K10K07; श्रुतिः C45E

dārāgnihotrasambandham ijyā śrautasya lakṣaṇam | दाराग्निहोत्रसम्बन्धमिज्या श्रौतस्य लक्षणम् ।
15cd °bandham i° em.; °baddha i° C94C45K82K07, °bandha i° K10E

 ------------------ 15cd cf. Manu 3.171ab: dārāgnihotrasaṁyogaṁ kurute yo 'graje sthite; and also MATSP 142.41: dārāgnihotrasambandham r̥gyajuḥsāmasaṁhitāḥ| ityādibahulaṁ śrautaṁ dharmaṁ saptarṣayo 'bruvan||
smārto varṇāśramācāro yamaiś ca niyamair yutaḥ ||3.15|| स्मार्तो वर्णाश्रमाचारो यमैश्च नियमैर्युतः ॥३:१५
15e smārto em.; smārta C94C45K82K10K07E
 १५ e: स्मार्तो em.; स्मार्त C94C45K82K10K07E
 ------------------ 15cdef ≈ MBH Indices 1.36.10: dānāgnihotram ijyā ca śrautasyaitad dhi lakṣaṇam| smārto varṇāśramācāro yamaiś ca niyamair yutaḥ|| ≈ MATSP 145.30cd–31ab: dārāgnihotrasambandham ijyā śrautasya lakṣaṇam| smārto varṇāśramācāro yamaiś ca niyamair yutaḥ|| ≈ BRAHMANDAPUR 1.32.33cd–34ab: dārāgnihotrasambandhād dvidhā śrautasya lakṣaṇam| smārto varṇāśramācārair yamaiḥ sa niyamaiḥ smr̥taḥ||
[ yamaniyamabhedaḥ ] [ यमनियमभेदः ]
yamaś ca niyamaś caiva dvayor bhedam ataḥ śr̥ṇu | यमश्च नियमश्चैव द्वयोर्भेदमतः शृणु ।
16a niyama° C94C45K10K07E; niyamai° K82
 १६ a: नियम° C94C45K10K07E; नियमै° K82
ahiṁsā satyam asteyam ānr̥śaṁsyaṁ damo ghr̥ṇā | अहिंसा सत्यमस्तेयमानृशंस्यं दमो घृणा ।
16d °m ānr̥śaṁsyaṁ em.; °m anr̥śaṁsyo C94C45K82K10E, °m ānr̥śaṁsyā K07

dhanyāpramādo mādhuryam ārjavaṁ ca yamā daśa ||3.16|| धन्याप्रमादो माधुर्यमार्जवं च यमा दश ॥३:१६

trāsanaṁ tāḍanaṁ bandho māraṇaṁ vr̥ttināśanam | त्रासनं ताडनं बन्धो मारणं वृत्तिनाशनम् ।

[ ahiṁsāpraśaṁsā ] [ अहिंसाप्रशंसा ]
ahiṁsā paramaṁ dharmaṁ yas tyajet sa durātmavān | अहिंसा परमं धर्मं यस्त्यजेत्स दुरात्मवान् ।
24c paramaṁ dharmaṁ C94C45K82E; paramaṁ dharma K10, paramo dharmaṁ K07
 २४ c: परमं धर्मं C94C45K82E; परमं धर्म K10, परमो धर्मं K07

 त्यजेत्स दुरात्मनम् K10
kleśāyāsavinirmuktaṁ sarvadharmaphalapradam ||3.24|| क्लेशायासविनिर्मुक्तं सर्वधर्मफलप्रदम् ॥३:२४
nātaḥ parataro mūrkho nātaḥ parataraṁ tamaḥ | नातः परतरो मूर्खो नातः परतरं तमः ।
25b °taraṁ C94C45pcK82K10K07; °tan C45acE
 २५ b: °तरं C94C45pcK82K10K07; °तन् C45acE
nātaḥ parataraṁ duḥkhaṁ nātaḥ parataro 'yaśaḥ ||3.25|| नातः परतरं दुःखं नातः परतरो ऽयशः ॥३:२५
nātaḥ parataraṁ pāpaṁ nātaḥ parataraṁ viṣam | नातः परतरं पापं नातः परतरं विषम् ।
nātaḥ paratarāvidyā nātaḥ paraṁ tapodhana ||3.26|| नातः परतराविद्या नातः परं तपोधन ॥३:२६

yo hinasti na bhūtāni udbhijjādi caturvidham | यो हिनस्ति न भूतानि उद्भिज्जादि चतुर्विधम् ।

28a °dayāṁ nityaṁ C94K82E; °dayā nityaṁ C45K10, °dayā nitya K07

 २९ a: परमं ती° C94K82K10K07E; परन्ती° C45
ahiṁsā paramaṁ dānam ahiṁsā paramaṁ sukham ||3.29|| अहिंसा परमं दानमहिंसा परमं सुखम् ॥३:२९
------------------ 29 This and the following verses are similar to MBh 13.117.37–38 ------------------ 29d C02 resumes here in exp. 189, f. 273r (sic!) with ramaṁ sukham
ahiṁsā paramo yajñaḥ ahiṁsā paramaṁ vratam | अहिंसा परमो यज्ञः अहिंसा परमं व्रतम् ।

[ māṁsāhāraḥ ] [ मांसाहारः ]
māṁsāśanān nivarteta manasāpi na kāṅkṣayet | मांसाशनान्निवर्तेत मनसापि न काङ्क्षयेत् ।
33a māṁsāśanān ni° C94C45E; mānsāśana ni° C02, ३३ a: मांसाशनान्नि° C94C45E; मान्साशन नि° C02, māṁsāśanan ni° K82, mansāsanan ni° K10, ≀māṁsaśānān ni≀° K07
 मांसाशनन्नि° K82, मन्सासनन्नि° K10, ≀मांसशानान्नि≀° K07
sa mahat phalam āpnoti yas tu māṁsaṁ vivarjayet ||3.33|| स महत्फलमाप्नोति यस्तु मांसं विवर्जयेत् ॥३:३३
33d māṁsaṁ CK82; māṁsa K10E, māsaṁ K07
 ३३ d: मांसं CK82; मांस K10E, मासं K07
svamāṁsaṁ paramāṁsena yo vardhayitum icchati | स्वमांसं परमांसेन यो वर्धयितुमिच्छति ।
34a °māṁsena CK82K10E; °māsena K07
 ३४ a: °मांसेन CK82K10E; °मासेन K07
 34b vardhayitu° CK82K07E; varddhayati K10
 ३४ b: वर्धयितु° CK82K07E; वर्द्धयति K10
 ------------------ 34ab = MBH 13.116.14ab and 13.116.34ab ≈ UUMS 2.48cd: svamāṁsaṁ paramāṁsena yo dehe vr̥ddhim icchati
anabhyarcya pitr̥̄n devān na tato 'nyo 'sti pāpakr̥t ||3.34|| अनभ्यर्च्य पितॄन्देवान्न ततो ऽन्यो ऽस्ति पापकृत् ॥३:३४
34c pitr̥̄n C94C45K82K07; pitr̥n C02E, ≀pitr̥̄n≀ K10
 ३४ c: पितॄन् C94C45K82K07; पितृन् C02E, ≀पितॄन≀ K10
 34d tato 'nyo CK82K10K07; tad anyo E
 ३४ d: ततो ऽन्यो CK82K10K07; तदन्यो E
 ------------------ 34 ≈ Manu 5.52
madhuparke ca yajñe ca pitr̥daivatakarmaṇi | मधुपर्के च यज्ञे च पितृदैवतकर्मणि ।
35b °daivata° C94C45K82K07E; °devata° C02K10
 ३५ b: °दैवत° C94C45K82K07E; °देवत° C02K10
atraiva paśavo hiṁsyā nānyatra manur abravīt ||3.35|| अत्रैव पशवो हिंस्या नान्यत्र मनुरब्रवीत् ॥३:३५
35c atraiva paśavo hiṁsyā C94C02K07E; ३५ c: अत्रैव पशवो हिंस्या C94C02K07E; atraiva paśavo hiṁsā C45, atraiva paśavo hiṁsyān K82, अत्रैव पशवो हिंसा C45, अत्रैव पशवो हिंस्यान् K82, ×××××××× K10

 ------------------ 35 ≈ Manu 5.41: madhuparke ca yajñe ca pitr̥daivatakarmaṇi| atraiva paśavo hiṁsyā nānyatrety abravīn manuḥ||
krītvā svayaṁ vāpy utpādya paropahr̥tam eva vā | क्रीत्वा स्वयं वाप्युत्पाद्य परोपहृतमेव वा ।
36a krītvā CK82K10K07; kr̥tvā E •

 ३६ b: °हृत° CK82K10K07; °हित° E •

 वा CK82K10K07; च E
devān pitr̥̄ṁś cārcayitvā khādan māṁsaṁ na doṣabhāk ||3.36|| देवान्पितॄंश्चार्चयित्वा खादन्मांसं न दोषभाक् ॥३:३६
36c pitr̥̄ṁś cārcayitvā CK82K07; pitr̥̄ś cārcayitvā K10, pitr̥ś cārpayitvā E

 ------------------ 36 = Manu 5.32 (in Olivelle's critical edition; other editions read paropakr̥ta°)
vedayajñatapastīrthadānaśīlakriyāvrataiḥ | वेदयज्ञतपस्तीर्थदानशीलक्रियाव्रतैः ।
37b °śīla° C94C45K82K10K07E; °śala° C02 •
 ३७ b: °शील° C94C45K82K10K07E; °शल° C02 •
 °vrataiḥ C94C02K82K10K07E; °vra≀taḥ≀ C45
 °व्रतैः C94C02K82K10K07E; °व्र≀तः≀ C45
māṁsāhāranivr̥ttānāṁ ṣoḍaśāṁśaṁ na pūryate ||3.37|| मांसाहारनिवृत्तानां षोडशांशं न पूर्यते ॥३:३७
37c °vr̥ttānāṁ CK82K07; °vr̥ttānā K10, °vr̥ttīnāṁ E

 37d na C94C02K82K10K07E; ta C45
 ३७ d: न C94C02K82K10K07E; त C45
mr̥gāḥ parṇatr̥ṇāhārād ajameṣagavādibhiḥ | मृगाः पर्णतृणाहारादजमेषगवादिभिः ।
38a parṇa° CK10K07; paṇṇa° K82, parṇā° E
 ३८ a: पर्ण° CK10K07; पण्ण° K82, पर्णा° E
 38ab °hārād a° C94C02K10pcK07E; °hād a° K10ac, °hārā a° C45K82
 ३८ ab: °हाराद° C94C02K10pcK07E; °हाद° K10ac, °हारा अ° C45K82
sukhino balavantaś ca vicaranti mahītale ||3.38|| सुखिनो बलवन्तश्च विचरन्ति महीतले ॥३:३८
vānarāḥ phala-m-āhārā rākṣasā rudhirapriyāḥ | वानराः फलमाहारा राक्षसा रुधिरप्रियाः ।
39ab °hārā rā° C45K82K10; °hārād rā° C94C02K07E
 ३९ ab: °हारा रा° C45K82K10; °हाराद्रा° C94C02K07E
nihatā rākṣasāḥ sarve vānaraiḥ phalabhojibhiḥ ||3.39|| निहता राक्षसाः सर्वे वानरैः फलभोजिभिः ॥३:३९
39d °bhojibhiḥ CK82K10K07; °bhogibhiḥ E
 ३९ d: °भोजिभिः CK82K10K07; °भोगिभिः E
tasmān māṁsaṁ na hīheta balakāmena bho dvija | तस्मान्मांसं न हीहेत बलकामेन भो द्विज ।
40a māṁsaṁ CK82K10E; māsaṁ K07
 ४० a: मांसं CK82K10E; मासं K07
 40b hīheta CK07E; hīyeta K82K10
 ४० b: हीहेत CK07E; हीयेत K82K10
balena ca guṇākarṣāt parato bhayabhīruṇā ||3.40|| बलेन च गुणाकर्षात्परतो भयभीरुणा ॥३:४०
40c guṇākarṣā° conj. Törzsök; guṇākāśā° CK82K10K07, guṇā kuryā° E

ahiṁsakasamo nāsti dānayajñasamīhayā | अहिंसकसमो नास्ति दानयज्ञसमीहया ।
41b °yajñasamīhayā C94C45K82K10; °dharmasamīhayā C02, ४१ b: °यज्ञसमीहया C94C45K82K10; °धर्मसमीहया C02, °yajñasamīhayāḥ K07, °dharmasamīhaya E

iha loke yaśaḥ kīrtiḥ paratra ca parā gatiḥ ||3.41|| इह लोके यशः कीर्तिः परत्र च परा गतिः ॥३:४१

trailokyaṁ maṇiratnapūrṇam akhilaṁ dattvottame brāhmaṇe त्रैलोक्यं मणिरत्नपूर्णमखिलं दत्त्वोत्तमे ब्राह्मणे

tīrthānāṁ ca sahasrakoṭiniyutaṁ snātvā sakr̥n mānavaḥ तीर्थानां च सहस्रकोटिनियुतं स्नात्वा सकृन्मानवः

     || iti vr̥ṣasārasaṁgrahe ahiṁsāpraśaṁsā nāmādhyāyas tr̥tīyaḥ ||      इति वृषसारसंग्रहे अहिंसाप्रशंसा नामाध्यायस्तृतीयः ॥
Colophon: nāmādhyāyas tr̥tīyaḥ CK82K10; nāmādhyāyas tr̥tīya K07, Colophon: नामाध्यायस्तृतीयः CK82K10; नामाध्यायस्तृतीय K07, nāmas tr̥tīyo 'dhyāyaḥ E
 नामस्तृतीयो ऽध्यायः E



[ caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ चतुर्थो ऽध्यायः ] [ yameṣu satyam (2) ] [ यमेषु सत्यम् (२) ]
anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।
------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 198v–201v, C45 ff. 206r–208v, C02 ff. 273v–277r, K82 ff. 6r–9r, K10 exp. 48–50 (lower–upper), K07 ff. 214v–217r, E pp. 591–597; C = C94 + C45 + C02
sadbhāvaḥ satyam ity āhur dr̥ṣṭapratyayam eva vā | सद्भावः सत्यमित्याहुर्दृष्टप्रत्ययमेव वा ।
1a sadbhāvaḥ CK82K07; sadbhāva° K10E
 १ a: सद्भावः CK82K07; सद्भाव° K10E
 1ab satyam ity āhur dr̥° C45K82K07E; satya≀m i≀ty āhu dr̥° C94, १ ab: सत्यमित्याहुर्दृ° C45K82K07E; सत्य≀मि≀त्याहु दृ° C94, satyam ity āhu dr̥° C02, satyām ity āhur dr̥° K10
 सत्यमित्याहु दृ° C02, सत्यामित्याहुर्दृ° K10
 1b °pratyaya° C94C45K82K10; °pratya° C02, °pratyeya° K07, pratyakṣa° E
 १ b: °प्रत्यय° C94C45K82K10; °प्रत्य° C02, °प्रत्येय° K07, प्रत्यक्ष° E
 ------------------ 1a ≈ MBH 12.288.45d: sadbhāvaḥ satyam ucyate •
cf. also BRAHMANDAPUR 3.3.86ab: asadbhāvo 'nr̥taṁ jñeyaṁ sadbhāvaḥ satyam ucyate
yathābhūtārthakathanaṁ tat satyakathanaṁ smr̥tam ||4.1|| यथाभूतार्थकथनं तत्सत्यकथनं स्मृतम् ॥४:१
1c yathābhūtārthakathanaṁ C94C45K82K10K07E; १ c: यथाभूतार्थकथनं C94C45K82K10K07E; yathābhūtārtha C02ac, yathābhūtārtha*kta kathanaṁ C02pc

 1d tat satyakathanaṁ C94C02K82K10K07E; १ d: तत्सत्यकथनं C94C02K82K10K07E; tat satyakathakaṁ C45, kathanaṁ smr̥taṁ C02ac, satyakakathanaṁ smr̥taṁ C02pc
 तत्सत्यकथकं C45, कथनं स्मृतं C02ac, सत्यककथनं स्मृतं C02pc
 ------------------ 1cd cf. SDHS 11.105: svānubhūtaṁ svadr̥ṣṭaṁ ca yaḥ pr̥ṣṭārthaṁ na gūhati| yathābhūtārthakathanam ity etat satyalakṣaṇam||
ākrośatāḍanādīni yaḥ saheta suduḥsaham | आक्रोशताडनादीनि यः सहेत सुदुःसहम् ।
2a °tāḍanā° C94C02K82K10K07E; °nāḍanā° C45
 २ a: °ताडना° C94C02K82K10K07E; °नाडना° C45
 2b suduḥsaham C94C45K82K10K07E; sudusahaṁ C02
 २ b: सुदुःसहम् C94C45K82K10K07E; सुदुसहं C02
kṣamate yo jitātmā tu sa ca satyam udāhr̥tam ||4.2|| क्षमते यो जितात्मा तु स च सत्यमुदाहृतम् ॥४:२
2d satyam udāhr̥tam C45C02K82K10K07E; २ d: सत्यमुदाहृतम् C45C02K82K10K07E; ≀satya≀m u≀dā≀hr̥tam C94
 ≀सत्य≀मु≀दा≀हृतम् C94
 ------------------ 2 cf. SDHS 11.82: ākruṣṭas tāḍito vāpi yo nākrośen na tāḍayet | vāgādy avikr̥taḥ svasthaṁ kṣāntir eṣā sunirmalā ||
vadhārtham udyataḥ śastraṁ yadi pr̥ccheta karhicit | वधार्थमुद्यतः शस्त्रं यदि पृच्छेत कर्हिचित् ।
3a °dyataḥ CK10K07E; °dyata K82 •
 ३ a: °द्यतः CK10K07E; °द्यत K82 •

 3b karhicit CE; karhacit K82K10K07
 ३ b: कर्हिचित् CE; कर्हचित् K82K10K07
na tatra satyaṁ vaktavyam anr̥taṁ satyam ucyate ||4.3|| न तत्र सत्यं वक्तव्यमनृतं सत्यमुच्यते ॥४:३
3c satyaṁ C94C02K82K10K07; satya C45E
 ३ c: सत्यं C94C02K82K10K07; सत्य C45E
vadhārhaḥ puruṣaḥ kaścid vrajet pathi bhayāturaḥ | वधार्हः पुरुषः कश्चिद्व्रजेत्पथि भयातुरः ।
4b °turaḥ C94C02K82K10K07E; °tura C45
 ४ b: °तुरः C94C02K82K10K07E; °तुर C45
pr̥cchato 'pi na vaktavyaṁ satyaṁ tad vāpi ucyate ||4.4|| पृच्छतो ऽपि न वक्तव्यं सत्यं तद्वापि उच्यते ॥४:४
4c pr̥cchato CK82K10K07; pr̥cchate E
 ४ c: पृच्छतो CK82K10K07; पृच्छते E

 ४ d: तद्वापि CK82K07E; तदपि K10
na narmayuktam anr̥taṁ hinasti न नर्मयुक्तमनृतं हिनस्ति
5a hinasti C94C45K10K07; hi nāsti C02K82E
 ५ a: हिनस्ति C94C45K10K07; हि नास्ति C02K82E
     na strīṣu rājan na vivāhakāle |     न स्त्रीषु राजन्न विवाहकाले ।

 ५ b: राजन्न C94C45K10K07E; राज न C02, राज्यं न K82
prāṇātyaye sarvadhanāpahāre प्राणात्यये सर्वधनापहारे
5c °tyaye CK82K07E; °tyaje K10 •

     pañcānr̥taṁ satyam udāharanti ||4.5||     पञ्चानृतं सत्यमुदाहरन्ति ॥४:५
------------------ 5 ≈ MBH 1.77.16: na narmayuktaṁ vacanaṁ hinasti na strīṣu rājan na vivāhakāle| prāṇātyaye sarvadhanāpahāre pañcānr̥tāny āhur apātakāni||; MBH 12.159.28: na narmayuktaṁ vacanaṁ hinasti na strīṣu rājan na vivāhakāle| na gurvarthe nātmano jīvitārthe pañcānr̥tāny āhur apātakāni||; MATSP 31.16: na narmayuktaṁ vacanaṁ hinasti na strīṣu rājan na vivāhakāle| Abhidharmakośabhāṣya 24114–24117 (introduced by mohajo mr̥ṣāvādo yathāha): na narmayuktam anr̥taṁ hi nāsti na strīṣu rājan na vivāhakāle| prāṇātyaye sarvadhanāpahāre pañcānr̥tāny āhur apātakāni|| etc.
devamānuṣatiryeṣu satyaṁ dharmaḥ paro yataḥ | देवमानुषतिर्येषु सत्यं धर्मः परो यतः ।
6b °mānuṣa° CK82K10E; °mānuṣya° K07 •
 ६ b: °मानुष° CK82K10E; °मानुष्य° K07 •

 सत्यं धर्म परो यतः K82K07, सत्यधर्म परो यतः K10, सत्यधर्मपरायणः E
satyaṁ śreṣṭhaṁ variṣṭhaṁ ca satyaṁ dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ ||4.6|| सत्यं श्रेष्ठं वरिष्ठं च सत्यं धर्मः सनातनः ॥४:६
6c śreṣṭhaṁ CK82K07; śreṣṭha K10E •
 ६ c: श्रेष्ठं CK82K07; श्रेष्ठ K10E •

satyaṁ sāgaram avyaktaṁ satyam akṣayabhogadam | सत्यं सागरमव्यक्तं सत्यमक्षयभोगदम् ।
7a satyaṁ C94C45K82K10K07E; satya C02

satyaṁ potaḥ paratrārthaṁ satyaṁ panthāna vistaram ||4.7|| सत्यं पोतः परत्रार्थं सत्यं पन्थान विस्तरम् ॥४:७

 ------------------ 9c ≈ VARP 193.36cd: satyaṁ svargasya sopānaṁ pārāvārasya naur iva
aśvamedhasahasraṁ ca satyaṁ ca tulayā dhr̥tam | अश्वमेधसहस्रं च सत्यं च तुलया धृतम् ।

 ------------------ 10 = MBH 1.69.22 = MBH Indices 13.20.330 = MARKP 8.42 = VDHU 3.265.7 ≈ MBH 12.156.26 (pāda d reads satyam evātiricyate) ≈ VDH 55.6 (pāda d reads satyam etad viśiṣyate); cf. SDHS 11.107: aśvamedhāyutaṁ pūrṇaṁ satyañ ca tulitaṁ purā| aśvamedhāyutāt satyam adhikaṁ bahubhir guṇaiḥ||
satyena tapate sūryaḥ satyena pr̥thivī sthitā | सत्येन तपते सूर्यः सत्येन पृथिवी स्थिता ।

[ yameṣv asteyam (3) ] [ यमेष्वस्तेयम् (३) ]
vigatarāga uvāca | विगतराग उवाच ।
na hi tr̥ptiṁ vijānāmi śrutvā dharmaṁ tavāpy aham | न हि तृप्तिं विजानामि श्रुत्वा धर्मं तवाप्यहम् ।

anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।

19b °kīrtitam C94C02K82K10K07E; °kīrttitām C45

tena cāsau vijānīyād dravyalobhabalāt kr̥tam ||4.21|| तेन चासौ विजानीयाद्द्रव्यलोभबलात्कृतम् ॥४:२१

prasthavyāja-upāyena kuṭumbaṁ trātum icchati | प्रस्थव्याज-उपायेन कुटुम्बं त्रातुमिच्छति ।

 ------------------ 29 The lower folio side in exposure 49 in K10 is rather blurred and seems to be partly erased, therefore all the readings in this MS for verses 4.29–46 are rather uncertain, even if not indicated explicitly.

[ yameṣv ānr̥śaṁsyam (4) ] [ यमेष्वानृशंस्यम् (४) ]
aṣṭamūrtiśivadveṣṭā pitur mātuś ca yo dviṣet | अष्टमूर्तिशिवद्वेष्टा पितुर्मातुश्च यो द्विषेत् ।
31a °śiva° CK82K10E; °śivaṁ K07
 ३१ a: °शिव° CK82K10E; °शिवं K07
gavāṁ vā atither dveṣṭā nr̥śaṁsāḥ pañca eva te ||4.31|| गवां वा अतिथेर्द्वेष्टा नृशंसाः पञ्च एव ते ॥४:३१
31c gavāṁ vā C94C02K82K07E; avām vā C45, **≀m vā≀ K10 •
 ३१ c: गवां वा C94C02K82K07E; अवाम्वा C45, **≀म्वा≀ K10 •

 31d nr̥śaṁsāḥ C94C02K82K10; nr̥śaṁsā C45K07E

aṣṭamūrtiḥ śivaḥ sākṣāt pañcavyomasamanvitaḥ | अष्टमूर्तिः शिवः साक्षात्पञ्चव्योमसमन्वितः ।
32a °mūrtiḥ CK82K10K07; °mūrti° E
 ३२ a: °मूर्तिः CK82K10K07; °मूर्ति° E

 ३२ b: °न्वितः C94C45K82K07E; °न्विताः C02K10
sūryaḥ somaś ca dīkṣaś ca dūṣakaḥ sa nr̥śaṁsakaḥ ||4.32|| सूर्यः सोमश्च दीक्षश्च दूषकः स नृशंसकः ॥४:३२
32c sūryaḥ CK82; ≀sūrya≀° K10K07, sūrya° E •

pitākāśasamo jñeyo janmotpattikaraḥ pitā | पिताकाशसमो ज्ञेयो जन्मोत्पत्तिकरः पिता ।
33b °karaḥ pitā C94C45K82K07E; °≀karaḥ pitā≀ K10, °karapitāḥ C02

pitr̥daivatam ādiś cam ānr̥śaṁsa tamanvitaḥ ||4.33|| पितृदैवत†मादिश्चमानृशंस तमन्वितः‡ ॥४:३३

pr̥thvyā gurutarī mātā ko na vandeta mātaram | पृथ्व्या गुरुतरी माता को न वन्देत मातरम् ।

 34b vandeta C94K82K10K07E; vandena vandeta C45, vandyeta C02
 ३४ b: वन्देत C94K82K10K07E; वन्देन वन्देत C45, वन्द्येत C02
yajñadānatapovedās tena sarvaṁ kr̥taṁ bhavet ||4.34|| यज्ञदानतपोवेदास्तेन सर्वं कृतं भवेत् ॥४:३४
34d sarvaṁ em.; sarva CK82K10K07E
 ३४ d: सर्वं em.; सर्व CK82K10K07E
gāvaḥ pavitraṁ maṅgalyaṁ devatānāṁ ca devatāḥ | गावः पवित्रं मङ्गल्यं देवतानां च देवताः ।
35a pavitraṁ CK82K07E; ≀pavitra≀ K10 •

 ------------------ 35a ≈ VISNUS 23.57c: gāvaḥ pavitramaṅgalyaṁ (goṣu lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitā) •

sarvadevamayā gāvas tasmād eva na hiṁsayet ||4.35|| सर्वदेवमया गावस्तस्मादेव न हिंसयेत् ॥४:३५
35d °smād eva C94C02K82K10K07; °smād uva C45, °smād gāvaṁ E
 ३५ d: °स्मादेव C94C02K82K10K07; °स्मादुव C45, °स्माद्गावं E
 ------------------ 35c = VDHU 3.291.25c
jātamātrasya lokasya gāvas trātā na saṁśayaḥ | जातमात्रस्य लोकस्य गावस्त्राता न संशयः ।
36a jātamātrasya lokasya C94C02K82K07E; jātamātra≀sya lokasya≀ K10, ३६ a: जातमात्रस्य लोकस्य C94C02K82K07E; जातमात्र≀स्य लोकस्य≀ K10, satasātasya C45ac, satasātasya nokasya C45pc

ghr̥taṁ kṣīraṁ dadhi mūtraṁ śakr̥tkarṣaṇam eva ca ||4.36|| घृतं क्षीरं दधि मूत्रं शकृत्कर्षणमेव च ॥४:३६

pañcāmr̥taṁ pañcapavitrapūtaṁ पञ्चामृतं पञ्चपवित्रपूतं

gobhir na tulyaṁ dhanam asti kiṁcid गोभिर्न तुल्यं धनमस्ति किंचिद्

atithiṁ yo 'nugaccheta atithiṁ yo 'numanyate | अतिथिं यो ऽनुगच्छेत अतिथिं यो ऽनुमन्यते ।
atithiṁ yo 'nupūjyeta atithiṁ yaḥ praśaṁsate ||4.40|| अतिथिं यो ऽनुपूज्येत अतिथिं यः प्रशंसते ॥४:४०

annavastrapradānair vā sarvaṁ vāpi nivedayet ||4.42|| अन्नवस्त्रप्रदानैर्वा सर्वं वापि निवेदयेत् ॥४:४२

na pr̥cched gotracaraṇaṁ svādhyāyaṁ deśajanmanī | न पृच्छेद्गोत्रचरणं स्वाध्यायं देशजन्मनी ।

cintayen manasā bhaktyā dharmaḥ svayam ihāgataḥ ||4.44|| चिन्तयेन्मनसा भक्त्या धर्मः स्वयमिहागतः ॥४:४४

 44d °gataḥ C94C45K82K07E; °gatāḥ C02, ga≀tam≀ K10
 ४४ d: °गतः C94C45K82K07E; °गताः C02, ग≀तम≀ K10
 ------------------ 44cd cf. 12.37cd: dvijarūpadharo dharmaḥ svayam eva ihāgataḥ
aśvamedhasahasrāṇi rājasūyaśatāni ca | अश्वमेधसहस्राणि राजसूयशतानि च ।
45b °sūya° C94K82K07E; °sūrya° C45C02, °sū≀rya≀° K10
 ४५ b: °सूय° C94K82K07E; °सूर्य° C45C02, °सू≀र्य≀° K10
puṇḍarīkasahasraṁ ca sarvatīrthatapaḥphalam ||4.45|| पुण्डरीकसहस्रं च सर्वतीर्थतपःफलम् ॥४:४५
45d °tapaḥ° CK82K10E; °tapa° K07 (unmetrical)
 ४५ d: °तपः° CK82K10E; °तप° K07 (unmetrical)
atithir yasya tuṣyeta nr̥śaṁsamatam utsr̥jet | अतिथिर्यस्य तुष्येत नृशंसमतमुत्सृजेत् ।
46b nr̥śaṁsamatam utsr̥jet C94K82K07; nr̥śaṁsamata utsr̥jet C45, ४६ b: नृशंसमतमुत्सृजेत् C94K82K07; नृशंसमत उत्सृजेत् C45, nr̥śaṁsakamamam utsr̥jet C02, nr̥sasamatam utsr̥jet K10, na saṁśaya samaśnute E
 नृशंसकमममुत्सृजेत् C02, नृससमतमुत्सृजेत् K10, न संशय समश्नुते E
sa tasya sakalaṁ puṇyaṁ prāpnuyān nātra saṁśayaḥ ||4.46|| स तस्य सकलं पुण्यं प्राप्नुयान्नात्र संशयः ॥४:४६
na gatim atithijñasya gatim āpnoti karhicit | †न गतिमतिथिज्ञस्य‡ गतिमाप्नोति कर्हिचित् ।
47a na gatim a° C94C45K10K07; na gati nā° K82, na tithim a° C02E

 ४७ b: कर्हिचित् C94E; कर्हचित् C45C02K82K10K07
tasmād atithim āyāntam abhigacchet kr̥tāñjaliḥ ||4.47|| तस्मादतिथिमायान्तमभिगच्छेत्कृताञ्जलिः ॥४:४७
47c °yānta° C94C45K82K10K07E; °yānti° C02

saktuprasthena caikena yajña āsīn mahādbhutaḥ | सक्तुप्रस्थेन चैकेन यज्ञ आसीन्महाद्भुतः ।

[ yameṣu damaḥ (5) ] [ यमेषु दमः (५) ]
dama eva manuṣyāṇāṁ dharmasārasamuccayaḥ | दम एव मनुष्याणां धर्मसारसमुच्चयः ।

 ------------------ 50b cf. e.g. MBH Indices 14.4.2477: śrotum icchāmi kārtsnyena dharmasārasamuccayam
damo dharmo damaḥ svargo damaḥ kīrtir damaḥ sukham ||4.50|| दमो धर्मो दमः स्वर्गो दमः कीर्तिर्दमः सुखम् ॥४:५०

------------------ 77cdef ≈ MBH Indices 12.30: brahmahatyāṁ surāpānaṁ steyaṁ gurvaṅganāgamam| mahānti pātakāny āhuḥ saṁyogaṁ caiva taiḥ saha|| ≈ Manu 11.55 (in Olivelle's edition): brahmahatyā surāpānaṁ steyaṁ gurvaṅganāgamaḥ| mahānti pātakāny āhuḥ saṁsargaś cāpi taiḥ saha|| cf. also YAJNS 3.227: brahmahā madyapaḥ stenas tathaiva gurutalpagaḥ| ete mahāpātakino yaś ca taiḥ saha saṁvaset||
mahāpātakam ity āhus tatsaṁyogī ca pañcamaḥ ||4.77|| महापातकमित्याहुस्तत्संयोगी च पञ्चमः ॥४:७७
anr̥taṁ ca samutkarṣe rājagāmī ca paiśunaḥ | अनृतं च समुत्कर्षे राजगामी च पैशुनः ।
78a samutkarṣe em.; samutkarṣaṁ C94K82, ७८ a: समुत्कर्षे em.; समुत्कर्षं C94K82, samutkarṣa C02K10K07E, samutka≀rṣa≀ C45

 ७८ b: राज° CK82K10K07; राज्ञी° E
guroś cālīkanirbandhaḥ samāni brahmahatyayā ||4.78|| गुरोश्चालीकनिर्बन्धः समानि ब्रह्महत्यया ॥४:७८
78c °nirbandhaḥ em.; °nirbaddhaḥ C45K07, nibaddhas C94C02K82K10, nirvaddhas E
 ७८ c: °निर्बन्धः em.; °निर्बद्धः C45K07, निबद्धस् C94C02K82K10, निर्वद्धस् E
 78d brahmahatyayā C45C02K82K10K07E; bra***yā C94
 ७८ d: ब्रह्महत्यया C45C02K82K10K07E; ब्र***या C94
 ------------------ 78 ≈ MBH 5.40.3 and Manu 11.56: anr̥taṁ ca samutkarṣe rājagāmi ca paiśunam| guroś cālīkanirbandhaḥ samāni brahmahatyayā|| ≈ VISNUS 37.1–4 ≈ AGNIP 168.25
brahmojjhaṁ vedanindā ca kūṭasākṣī suhr̥dvadhaḥ | ब्रह्मोज्झं वेदनिन्दा च कूटसाक्षी सुहृद्वधः ।
79a brahmojjhaṁ em.; brahmo r̥g° CK82K10K07, brahma r̥g° E
 ७९ a: ब्रह्मोज्झं em.; ब्रह्मो ऋग° CK82K10K07, ब्रह्म ऋग° E
 79b suhr̥d vadhaḥ CK82K10K07; sakr̥d budhaḥ E
 ७९ b: सुहृद्वधः CK82K10K07; सकृद्बुधः E
garhitānādyayor jagdhiḥ surāpānasamāni ṣaṭ ||4.79|| गर्हितानाद्ययोर्जग्धिः सुरापानसमानि षट् ॥४:७९
79c °nādyayor jagdhiḥ em.; °nnañ ca yo jagdhis C94, °nnañ ca yo jagdhi C45, ७९ c: °नाद्ययोर्जग्धिः em.; °न्नञ्च यो जग्धिस् C94, °न्नञ्च यो जग्धि C45, °nnañ ca yodvignaḥ C02, °nnaṁ ca yo jagdhiḥ K82, °nnaṁ ca yo jagdhiḥ K10, °न्नञ्च योद्विग्नः C02, °न्नं च यो जग्धिः K82, °न्नं च यो जग्धिः K10, °nnañ ca yo jave K07, °nnaś ca yo vipraḥ E
 °न्नञ्च यो जवे K07, °न्नश्च यो विप्रः E
 ------------------ 79 ≈ Manu 11.57: brahmojjhatā vedanindā kauṭasākṣyaṁ suhr̥dvadhaḥ| garhitānādyayor jagdhiḥ surāpānasamāni ṣaṭ|| cf. YAJNS 3.228: gurūṇām adhyadhikṣepo vedanindā suhr̥dvadhaḥ| brahmahatyāsamaṁ jñeyam adhītasya ca nāśanam||
retotsekaḥ svayonyāsu kumārīṣv antyajāsu ca | रेतोत्सेकः स्वयोन्यासु कुमारीष्वन्त्यजासु च ।

 ८० a: स्वयोन्यासु C94C02K82K10K07E; सुतोन्यासु C45

[ pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ पञ्चमो ऽध्यायः ] [ niyamāḥ ] [ नियमाः ]
vigatarāga uvāca | विगतराग उवाच ।
1 vigatarāga uvāca C45C02K82K10K07ME; vigata≀rāga uvā≀ca C94
 1: विगतराग उवाच C45C02K82K10K07ME; विगत≀राग उवा≀च C94
 ------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 201v–202r, C45 ff. 208v–209r, C02 ff. 277r–278r, K82 ff. 9r–9v, K10 exp. 50 (upper) and 51 (lower), K07 ff. 217r–218r, M ff. 9r–10r, E pp. 597–599; C = C94 + C45 + C02
kathaya niyamatattvaṁ sāmprataṁ tvaṁ viśeṣād कथय नियमतत्त्वं साम्प्रतं त्वं विशेषाद्
1a kathaya ni° CK82K10K07M; kathayati E •
 १ a: कथय नि° CK82K10K07M; कथयति E •
 °tattvaṁ C94C02K82K10K07ME; taṁ C45 •
 °तत्त्वं C94C02K82K10K07ME; तं C45 •
 sāmprataṁ tvaṁ viśeṣād C94K82K07E; tvāṁ vaśeṣāt C45, साम्प्रतं त्वं विशेषाद् C94K82K07E; त्वां वशेषात् C45, sāṁprata tvaṁ viseṣāt C02K10, sāmprataṁ tvaṁ viśeṣā M

     amr̥tavacanatulyaṁ śrotukāmo gato 'smi |     अमृतवचनतुल्यं श्रोतुकामो गतो ऽस्मि ।

[ niyameṣu śaucam (1) ] [ नियमेषु शौचम् (१) ]
tatra śaucādinirdeśaṁ vakṣyāmīha dvijottama | तत्र शौचादिनिर्देशं वक्ष्यामीह द्विजोत्तम ।

 ------------------ 13ab ≈ Manu 5.5ab: laśunaṁ gr̥ñjanaṁ caiva palāṇḍuṁ kavakāni ca
gauraṁ ca sūkaraṁ māṁsaṁ varjayec ca vidhānataḥ ||5.13|| गौरं च सूकरं मांसं वर्जयेच्च विधानतः ॥५:१३

mānaveṣu purāṇeṣu śaivabhāratasaṁhite | मानवेषु पुराणेषु शैवभारतसंहिते ।

[ ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ षष्ठो ऽध्यायः ] [ niyameṣv ijyā (2) ] [ नियमेष्विज्या (२) ]
atha pañcavidhām ijyāṁ pravakṣyāmi dvijottama | अथ पञ्चविधामिज्यां प्रवक्ष्यामि द्विजोत्तम ।
1a °m ijyāṁ C45; °m ījyāṁ C94C02K82K10K07E
 १ a: °मिज्यां C45; °मीज्यां C94C02K82K10K07E
 1b °ttama CK82E; °ttamaḥ K10K07
 १ b: °त्तम CK82E; °त्तमः K10K07
 ------------------ Testimonia for this chapter: C94 ff. 202r–203r, C45 ff. 209r–209v, C02 ff. 278r–279r, K82 ff. 9v–10v, K10 exp. 51 (lower–upper) – 52 (lower), K07 ff. 218r-218v, E pp. 599–601; C = C94 + C45 + C02
dharmamokṣaprasiddhyarthaṁ śr̥ṇuṣvāvahito dvija ||6.1|| धर्ममोक्षप्रसिद्ध्यर्थं शृणुष्वावहितो द्विज ॥६:१
1c °mokṣaprasiddhyarthaṁ CK07; °mokṣaprasiddhyartha K82K10, १ c: °मोक्षप्रसिद्ध्यर्थं CK07; °मोक्षप्रसिद्ध्यर्थ K82K10, °mokṣeśasiddhyaarthaṁ E

arthayajñaḥ kriyāyajño japayajñas tathaiva ca | अर्थयज्ञः क्रियायज्ञो जपयज्ञस्तथैव च ।
2a arthayajñaḥ C94C02K82; anarthayajñaḥ C45, arthayajña K10K07, arthayajña° E

svahastakr̥tasaṁskāraḥ kriyāyajña sa ucyate ||6.4|| स्वहस्तकृतसंस्कारः क्रियायज्ञ स उच्यते ॥६:४

[ japayajñaḥ ] [ जपयज्ञः ]
japayajñaṁ tato vakṣye svargamokṣaphalapradam | जपयज्ञं ततो वक्ष्ये स्वर्गमोक्षफलप्रदम् ।
5a °yajñaṁ tato C94K82K10K07E; °yajñaṁ tapo C45 °yajñas tato C02
 ५ a: °यज्ञं ततो C94K82K10K07E; °यज्ञं तपो C45 °यज्ञस्ततो C02
vedādhyayana kartavyaṁ śivasaṁhitam eva ca | वेदाध्ययन कर्तव्यं शिवसंहितमेव च ।

itihāsapurāṇaṁ ca japayajñaḥ sa ucyate ||6.5|| इतिहासपुराणं च जपयज्ञः स उच्यते ॥६:५

 ५ e: °पुराणं च CK82K10K07; °पुराणश्च E

 ५ f: °यज्ञः C94C45K82K10K07E; °यज्ञ C02
[ jñānayajñaḥ ] [ ज्ञानयज्ञः ]
idaṁ karma akarmedam ūhāpohaviśāradaḥ | इदं कर्म अकर्मेदमूहापोहविशारदः ।
6a karma CK82K10K07; kramam E
 ६ a: कर्म CK82K10K07; क्रमम् E
śāstracakṣuḥ samālokya jñānayajñaḥ sa ucyate ||6.6|| शास्त्रचक्षुः समालोक्य ज्ञानयज्ञः स उच्यते ॥६:६
6c °cakṣuḥ C94C45K82K10K07E; °cakṣu C02
 ६ c: °चक्षुः C94C45K82K10K07E; °चक्षु C02
 6d °yajñaḥ C94C45K82K07E; °yajña C02, °≀yajñas≀ K10
 ६ d: °यज्ञः C94C45K82K07E; °यज्ञ C02, °≀यज्ञस≀ K10
[ dhyānayajñaḥ ] [ ध्यानयज्ञः ]
dhyānayajñaṁ samāsena kathayiṣyāmi te śr̥ṇu | ध्यानयज्ञं समासेन कथयिष्यामि ते शृणु ।
7a °yajñaṁ C94C45K82K07E; °yajña C02K10
 ७ a: °यज्ञं C94C45K82K07E; °यज्ञ C02K10
dhyānaṁ pañcavidhaṁ caiva kīrtitaṁ hariṇā purā | ध्यानं पञ्चविधं चैव कीर्तितं हरिणा पुरा ।
7c dhyānaṁ CK10E; dhyāna K82K07
 ७ c: ध्यानं CK10E; ध्यान K82K07
sūryaḥ somo 'gni sphaṭikaḥ sūkṣmaṁ tattvaṁ ca pañcamam ||6.7|| सूर्यः सोमो ऽग्नि स्फटिकः सूक्ष्मं तत्त्वं च पञ्चमम् ॥६:७
7e somo C94C02K82K07; somā° C45K10E
 ७ e: सोमो C94C02K82K07; सोमा° C45K10E
 7f sūkṣmaṁ tattvaṁ ca pañcamam C45; ७ f: सूक्ष्मं तत्त्वं च पञ्चमम् C45; sūkṣmaṁ ta≀tva≀×××ñcamam C94, सूक्ष्मं त≀त्व≀×××ञ्चमम् C94, sūkṣmatattvaṁ ca pañcamaḥ C02K82K10, सूक्ष्मतत्त्वं च पञ्चमः C02K82K10, sūkṣmaṁ tattvañ ca pañcamaḥ K07, सूक्ष्मं तत्त्वञ्च पञ्चमः K07, sūkṣmāṁ tattvaś ca pañcamam E
 सूक्ष्मां तत्त्वश्च पञ्चमम् E
sūryamaṇḍalam ādau tu tattvaṁ prakr̥tir ucyate | सूर्यमण्डलमादौ तु तत्त्वं प्रकृतिरुच्यते ।
tasya madhye śaśiṁ dhyāyet tattvaṁ puruṣa ucyate ||6.8|| तस्य मध्ये शशिं ध्यायेत्तत्त्वं पुरुष उच्यते ॥६:८
8c śaśiṁ CK82E; śaśi K10, śaśiṁn K07
 ८ c: शशिं CK82E; शशि K10, शशिंन् K07

 ८ cd: ध्यायेत्त° C94C45K82K10K07E; ध्याये त° C02
candramaṇḍalamadhye tu jvālām agniṁ vicintayet | चन्द्रमण्डलमध्ये तु ज्वालामग्निं विचिन्तयेत् ।
9b jvālām agniṁ CK82K10E; jālām agni K07
 ९ b: ज्वालामग्निं CK82K10E; जालामग्नि K07

akīrtitam anaupamyaṁ śivam akṣayam avyayam | अकीर्तितमनौपम्यं शिवमक्षयमव्ययम् ।

pañcamaṁ dhyānayajñasya tattvam uktaṁ samāsataḥ ||6.11|| पञ्चमं ध्यानयज्ञस्य तत्त्वमुक्तं समासतः ॥६:११

vigatarāga uvāca | विगतराग उवाच ।
ekaikasya tu tattvasya phalaṁ kīrtaya kīdr̥śam | एकैकस्य तु तत्त्वस्य फलं कीर्तय कीदृशम् ।

anarthayajña uvāca | अनर्थयज्ञ उवाच ।

na kālasaṁkhyā tatrāsti śivena saha modate ||6.17|| न कालसंख्या तत्रास्ति शिवेन सह मोदते ॥६:१७

[ niyameṣu tapaḥ (3) ] [ नियमेषु तपः (३) ]
mānasaṁ tapa ādau tu dvitīyaṁ vācikaṁ tapaḥ | मानसं तप आदौ तु द्वितीयं वाचिकं तपः ।

 ------------------ 20 ≈ MBH 6.39.16 (BHG 17.16): manaḥprasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātmavinigrahaḥ| bhāvasaṁśuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam ucyate||
anudvegakarā vāṇī priyaṁ satyaṁ hitaṁ ca yat | अनुद्वेगकरा वाणी प्रियं सत्यं हितं च यत् ।
svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ caiva vācikaṁ tapa ucyate ||6.21|| स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाचिकं तप उच्यते ॥६:२१

 ------------------ 21cd ≈ MBH 6.39.15cd (BHG 17.15): anudvegakaraṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priyahitaṁ ca yat| svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ caiva vāṅmayaṁ tapa ucyate||
ārjavaṁ ca ahiṁsā ca brahmacaryaṁ surārcanam | आर्जवं च अहिंसा च ब्रह्मचर्यं सुरार्चनम् ।

[ saptamo 'dhyāyaḥ ] [ सप्तमो ऽध्यायः ] [ niyameṣu dānam (4) ] [ नियमेषु दानम् (४) ]
dānāni ca tathety āhuḥ pañcadhā munibhiḥ purā | दानानि च तथेत्याहुः पञ्चधा मुनिभिः पुरा ।
1a tathety āhuḥ C94C02K10K07E; tathaity āhuḥ C45K82
 १ a: तथेत्याहुः C94C02K10K07E; तथैत्याहुः C45K82
annaṁ vastraṁ hiraṇyaṁ ca bhūmi godāna pañcamam ||7.1|| अन्नं वस्त्रं हिरण्यं च भूमि गोदान पञ्चमम् ॥७:१
1c vastraṁ C94C45K82K07E; vastra C02K10
 १ c: वस्त्रं C94C45K82K07E; वस्त्र C02K10
[ annadānam ] [ अन्नदानम् ]
annāt tejaḥ smr̥tiḥ prāṇaḥ annāt puṣṭir vapuḥ sukham | अन्नात्तेजः स्मृतिः प्राणः अन्नात्पुष्टिर्वपुः सुखम् ।
2a annāt tejaḥ smr̥tiḥ prāṇaḥ CK82pcK10; annāt tejaḥ smr̥tiḥ prāṇa K82ac, २ a: अन्नात्तेजः स्मृतिः प्राणः CK82pcK10; अन्नात्तेजः स्मृतिः प्राण K82ac, annāt tejaḥ smr̥ti prāṇaḥ K07, अन्नात्तेजः स्मृति प्राणः K07, annād bhavanti bhūtāni E

tasmād annasamaṁ dānaṁ na bhūtaṁ na bhaviṣyati ||7.5|| तस्मादन्नसमं दानं न भूतं न भविष्यति ॥७:५

 ------------------ 5cd = ŚDhU 7.31cd ≈ MBh 13.62.6ab: annena sadr̥śaṁ dānaṁ na bhūtaṁ na bhaviṣyati
[ vastradānam ] [ वस्त्रदानम् ]
vastrābhāvān manuṣyasya śriyād api parityajet | वस्त्राभावान्मनुष्यस्य श्रियादपि परित्यजेत् ।
6a °bhāvān ma° CK10E; °bhāvāt ma° K82K07
 ६ a: °भावान्म° CK10E; °भावात्म° K82K07
 6b śriyād api C94C02K82K10E; priyād api C45, śriyā vāpi K07
 ६ b: श्रियादपि C94C02K82K10E; प्रियादपि C45, श्रिया वापि K07
vastrahīno na pūjyeta bhāryāputrasakhādibhiḥ ||7.6|| वस्त्रहीनो न पूज्येत भार्यापुत्रसखादिभिः ॥७:६
vidyāvān sukulīno 'pi jñānavān guṇavān api | विद्यावान्सुकुलीनो ऽपि ज्ञानवान्गुणवानपि ।
vastrahīnaḥ parādhīnaḥ paribhūtaḥ pade pade ||7.7|| वस्त्रहीनः पराधीनः परिभूतः पदे पदे ॥७:७
apamānam avajñāṁ ca vastrahīno hy avāpnuyāt | अपमानमवज्ञां च वस्त्रहीनो ह्यवाप्नुयात् ।
8a °vajñāṁ CK82K10K07; °vajñaṁ E
 ८ a: °वज्ञां CK82K10K07; °वज्ञं E
 8b °hīno C94C02K82K10K07E; °hī C45
 ८ b: °हीनो C94C02K82K10K07E; °ही C45
jugupsati mahātmāpi sabhāstrījanasaṁsadi ||7.8|| जुगुप्सति महात्मापि सभास्त्रीजनसंसदि ॥७:८
tasmād vastrapradānāni praśaṁsanti manīṣiṇaḥ | तस्माद्वस्त्रप्रदानानि प्रशंसन्ति मनीषिणः ।
na jīrṇaṁ sphuṭitaṁ dadyād vastraṁ kutsitam eva vā ||7.9|| न जीर्णं स्फुटितं दद्याद्वस्त्रं कुत्सितमेव वा ॥७:९
9c jīrṇaṁ sphuṭitaṁ CK82K07; jīrṇasphaṭitaṁ K10E

 ९ d: कुत्सितमेव वा C94C45K82K10E; कुत्सितमेव च C02, कुत्सित्मेव वा K07
navaṁ purāṇarahitaṁ mr̥du sūkṣmaṁ suśobhanam | नवं पुराणरहितं मृदु सूक्ष्मं सुशोभनम् ।
10b sūkṣmaṁ C94C45K82K10K07; sūkṣma C02, śuklaṁ E
 १० b: सूक्ष्मं C94C45K82K10K07; सूक्ष्म C02, शुक्लं E
susaṁskr̥tya pradātavyaṁ śraddhābhaktisamanvitam ||7.10|| सुसंस्कृत्य प्रदातव्यं श्रद्धाभक्तिसमन्वितम् ॥७:१०
10c °dātavyaṁ C94C45K82K10K07E; °dātavya C02

śraddhāsattvaviśeṣeṇa deśakālavidhena ca | श्रद्धासत्त्वविशेषेण देशकालविधेन च ।
11a °sattva° CK82K10K07; °sa ca° E
 ११ a: °सत्त्व° CK82K10K07; °स च° E
pātradravyaviśeṣeṇa phalam āhuḥ pr̥thak pr̥thak ||7.11|| पात्रद्रव्यविशेषेण फलमाहुः पृथक्पृथक् ॥७:११
------------------ 11 cf. Manu 7.86–87 (the latter usually labelled as an additional verse): pātrasya hi viśeṣeṇa śraddadhānatayāiva ca| alpaṁ vā bahu vā pretya dānasya phalam aśnute|| deśakālavidhānena dravyaṁ śraddhāsamanvitam| pātre pradīyate yat tu tad dharmasya prasādhanam||
yādr̥śaṁ dīyate vastraṁ tādr̥śaṁ prāpyate phalam | यादृशं दीयते वस्त्रं तादृशं प्राप्यते फलम् ।
jīrṇavastrapradānena jīrṇavastram avāpnuyāt | जीर्णवस्त्रप्रदानेन जीर्णवस्त्रमवाप्नुयात् ।
śobhanaṁ dīyate vastraṁ śobhanaṁ vastram āpnuyāt ||7.12|| शोभनं दीयते वस्त्रं शोभनं वस्त्रमाप्नुयात् ॥७:१२
dadyād vastra suśobhanaṁ dvijavare kāle śubhe sādaram दद्याद्वस्त्र सुशोभनं द्विजवरे काले शुभे सादरम्
13a dvijavare kāle śubhe CK82K10K07; dvijayine ekāśubhaṁ E
 १३ a: द्विजवरे काले शुभे CK82K10K07; द्विजयिने एकाशुभं E
     saubhāgyam atulaṁ labheta sa naro rūpaṁ tathā śobhanam |     सौभाग्यमतुलं लभेत स नरो रूपं तथा शोभनम् ।
13b naro C94C02K82K10K07E; daro C45
 १३ b: नरो C94C02K82K10K07E; दरो C45
tasmin yāti suvastrakoṭi śataśaḥ prāpnoti niḥsaṁśayam तस्मिन्याति सुवस्त्रकोटि शतशः प्राप्नोति निःसंशयम्

[ suvarṇadānam ] [ सुवर्णदानम् ]
suvarṇadānaṁ viprendra saṁkṣipya kathayāmy aham | सुवर्णदानं विप्रेन्द्र संक्षिप्य कथयाम्यहम् ।
14a °dānaṁ CK82K07; °dāna K10E
 १४ a: °दानं CK82K07; °दान K10E
pavitraṁ maṅgalaṁ puṇyaṁ sarvapātakanāśanam ||7.14|| पवित्रं मङ्गलं पुण्यं सर्वपातकनाशनम् ॥७:१४
14d °pātaka° C45C02K82K10K07E; °pāpaka° C94
 १४ d: °पातक° C45C02K82K10K07E; °पापक° C94
dhārayet satataṁ vipra suvarṇakaṭakāṅgulim | धारयेत्सततं विप्र सुवर्णकटकाङ्गुलिम् ।
15b °kaṭakāṅgulim C45C02K82K07E; °ka**gulim C94, °kaṭakāṅgulam K10
 १५ b: °कटकाङ्गुलिम् C45C02K82K07E; °क**गुलिम् C94, °कटकाङ्गुलम् K10
mucyate sarvapāpebhyo rāhunā candramā yathā ||7.15|| मुच्यते सर्वपापेभ्यो राहुना चन्द्रमा यथा ॥७:१५

dattvā suvarṇaṁ viprebhyo devebhyaś ca dvijarṣabha | दत्त्वा सुवर्णं विप्रेभ्यो देवेभ्यश्च द्विजर्षभ ।

[ bhūmidānam ] [ भूमिदानम् ]
sarvādhāraṁ mahīdānaṁ praśaṁsanti manīṣiṇaḥ | सर्वाधारं महीदानं प्रशंसन्ति मनीषिणः ।
18a °dhāraṁ C45; °dhāra° C94C02K82K10K07E
 १८ a: °धारं C45; °धार° C94C02K82K10K07E

 १८ ab: °दानं प्रशंसन्ति C45C02K82K10K07E; दा*≀नम्प्र≀×सन्ति C94
annavastrahiraṇyādi sarvaṁ vai bhūmisambhavam ||7.18|| अन्नवस्त्रहिरण्यादि सर्वं वै भूमिसम्भवम् ॥७:१८
18d sarvaṁ vai C45C02K82K10K07E; sarvaṁ ≀ve≀ C94 (top of akṣaras lost)
 १८ d: सर्वं वै C45C02K82K10K07E; सर्वं ≀वे≀ C94 (top of akṣaras lost)
bhūmidānena viprendra sarvadānaphalaṁ labhet | भूमिदानेन विप्रेन्द्र सर्वदानफलं लभेत् ।
19b °phalaṁ labhet CK82K10pcE; °lalaṁ bhavet K10ac, °laṁ bhavet K07
 १९ b: °फलं लभेत् CK82K10pcE; °ललं भवेत् K10ac, °लं भवेत् K07
bhūmidānasamaṁ vipra yady asti vada tattvataḥ ||7.19|| भूमिदानसमं विप्र यद्यस्ति वद तत्त्वतः ॥७:१९
mātr̥kukṣivimuktas tu dharaṇīśaraṇo bhavet | मातृकुक्षिविमुक्तस्तु धरणीशरणो भवेत् ।

ekahastaṁ dvihastaṁ vā pañcāśac chatam eva vā | एकहस्तं द्विहस्तं वा पञ्चाशच्छतमेव वा ।
21a ekahastaṁ C45K82K10K07; ekahasta° C94C02E

21d bhūmidānaṁ praśasyate C94C02K82K07E; bhūmidāna praśasyate C45, २१ d: भूमिदानं प्रशस्यते C94C02K82K07E; भूमिदान प्रशस्यते C45, pañcāśac chatam eva vā| sahāyutalakṣam vā bhūmidaṁ praśasyate K10 (eyeskip)

[ dānapraśaṁsā ] [ दानप्रशंसा ]

     dānād eva anantabhoga niyataṁ svargaṁ ca tasmād bhavet ||7.27||     दानादेव अनन्तभोग नियतं स्वर्गं च तस्माद्भवेत् ॥७:२७

 २७ d: दानादेव C94C45K82K10K07E; दानादोव C02 •
 °niyataṁ C94C45K82K10K07E; °niyata C02
 °नियतं C94C45K82K10K07E; °नियत C02
dānād eva ca śakralokasakalaṁ dānāj janānandanam दानादेव च शक्रलोकसकलं दानाज्जनानन्दनम्

 २८ a: शक्रलोकसकलं CK10K07; शत्रुलोकसकलं K82, शक्रलोकमतुलं E •
 dānāj ja° C02K82K10K07E; dānā ja° C94, dānārja° C45
 दानाज्ज° C02K82K10K07E; दाना ज° C94, दानार्ज° C45
     dānād eva mahīṁ samasta bubhuje samrāḍ mahīmaṇḍale |     दानादेव महीं समस्त बुभुजे सम्राड्महीमण्डले ।
28b dānād eva C94C02K82K10K07E; dāned eva C45 •
 २८ b: दानादेव C94C02K82K10K07E; दानेदेव C45 •
 mahīṁ samasta conj.; mahīsamāsu C45C02, mahīṁ samāṁsu C94K82K07, महीं समस्त conj.; महीसमासु C45C02, महीं समांसु C94K82K07, mahī samasta K10, mahīyasāṁ sa E •
 मही समस्त K10, महीयसां स E •
 samrāḍ ma° C94C02K82K10K07E; saṁmrāḍ ma° C45
 सम्राड्म° C94C02K82K10K07E; संम्राड्म° C45
dānād eva surūpayonisubhagaś candrānano vīkṣyate दानादेव सुरूपयोनिसुभगश्चन्द्राननो वीक्ष्यते
28c surūpa° CK82K07E; svarūpa° K10 •
 २८ c: सुरूप° CK82K07E; स्वरूप° K10 •
 °yonisu° K10E; °yonis su° C94 °yoniḥ su° C45C02K82K07 •
 °योनिसु° K10E; °योनिस्सु° C94 °योनिः सु° C45C02K82K07 •
 °bhagaś ca° C94C02K10K07; °bhaga ca° C45K82E •
 °भगश्च° C94C02K10K07; °भग च° C45K82E •
 °ndrānano C94C45K82E; °ndrānane C02K10, °ndrānanau K07 •
 °न्द्राननो C94C45K82E; °न्द्रानने C02K10, °न्द्राननौ K07 •
 vīkṣyate C45C02; vīkṣate C94K82K10K07, vikṣate E
 वीक्ष्यते C45C02; वीक्षते C94K82K10K07, विक्षते E
     dānād eva anekasambhavasukhaṁ prāpnoti niḥsaṁśayam ||7.28||     दानादेव अनेकसम्भवसुखं प्राप्नोति निःसंशयम् ॥७:२८
28d niḥsaṁśayam C94C45K07; nisaṁśayaḥ C02, niḥsaṁśayaḥ K82E, nissayaḥ K10
 २८ d: निःसंशयम् C94C45K07; निसंशयः C02, निःसंशयः K82E, निस्सयः K10
     || iti vr̥ṣasārasaṁgrahe dānapraśaṁsādhyāyaḥ saptamaḥ ||      इति वृषसारसंग्रहे दानप्रशंसाध्यायः सप्तमः ॥
Colophon: °praśaṁsādhyāyaḥ saptamaḥ C94C02K82K10K07; Colophon: °प्रशंसाध्यायः सप्तमः C94C02K82K10K07; °praśaṁsādhyāyaḥ samāptaḥ C45, °प्रशंसाध्यायः समाप्तः C45, °praśaṁsā saptamo 'dhyāyaḥ E
 °प्रशंसा सप्तमो ऽध्यायः E









Translation




Chapter One

Invocation

|1.1| Having bowed to the One who has no beginning, no middle part and no end, whose boundaries are limitless, who is very subtle and who is the unmanifest and fine essence of the world, to the One who is wholly complete with Hari, Indra, Brahmā and the other [gods], I shall recite [the work called] ‘A Compendium on the Essence of the Bull [of Dharma]’.

The dialogue of Janamejaya and Vaiśampāyana

|1.2| Having listened to the Bhāratasaṁhitā [i.e. the Mahābhārata], the supreme book of a hundred thousand [verses] and a thousand chapters (adhyāya), with all its hundred sections (parvan),

|1.3| Janamejaya remained unsatisfied. Listen unweariedly to what he asked Vaiśampāyana in the past.

Janamejaya spoke:

|1.4| O venerable sir, O knower of the entire Dharma, O you who are well-versed in all the sciences (śāstra)! There is a supreme and secret Dharma [that causes] liberation from the ocean of mundane existence (saṁsāra).

|1.5| Teach me the Dharma that emerged from [Vyāsa] Dvaipāyana’s mouth, O best of Brahmins. Help me find satisfaction at all cost, O great ascetic!

Vaiśampāyana spoke:

|1.6| Listen with great attention, O king, to this unsurpassed narration of Dharma. Hear the secret Dharma that I received by Vyāsa’s favour.

|1.8| – |1.9| Viṣṇu, the great Lord, assuming the form of a twice-born [Brahmin], wanted to test [Anarthayajña, the ascetic yogin] who performed nonmaterial sacrifices (anarthayajña), focused on his austerities and observances, whose conduct was virtuous and pure, and who was intent on compassion towards all living beings; therefore he [Viṣṇu] humbly asked him a question.

The knowledge of Brahman

[Vigatarāga spoke:]

|1.9| How is the knowledge of the Brahman to be understood if it is devoid of form and colour? The syllable that is devoid of vowels and consonants: is there anything higher than that?

Anarthayajña replied:

|1.10| That syllable is not to be pronounced, is unquestionable, non-dividable, consistent, spotless, all-pervading and subtle: what could be higher than that?

The noose of death and time

Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.11| When the body disintegrates in the ground, in water, in fire or [is torn apart] by jackals and other [animals], how is the supportless and spotless soul led [to the netherworld] by Yama’s messengers?

|1.12| How is it bound by the nooses of death/time? And if it is bodiless, how can it move? And how does the [soul of a] virtuous [person] (bahudharmakr̥t) reach heaven if it has no body? This is my doubt. Teach me. I want to know the truth.

Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.13| You are asking me about an extremely doubtful and problematic matter, O truest of the twice-born. [This is something that] is difficult to understand by humans, and [even] by gods (deva), demons (dānava) and serpents (pannaga).

|1.14| The cause of both the birth and death of the body is karma. Good and bad deeds are called the two nooses.

|1.15| [The soul] goes to hell or heaven accordingly. Happiness and suffering, both arising from karma, are to be experienced by the body.

|1.16| It is for this reason, O great Brahmin, that the human body is born. Now learn about that which they call the noose of time, I shall teach you, O you of great observances.

|1.17| [If] you don’t know anything, how could you start your investigation, O twice-born? O great Brahmin, you should know the noose of time in its entirety.

|1.18| Learn about time (kāla) which is divided into digits (kalā), [i.e. about] the division[s] (kalā) of the entity [called] time (kālatattva). Two atomic units of time (truṭi) is one twinkling (nimeṣa). One digit (kalā, cca. 1.6 second) is twice a twinkling.

|1.19| Two digits (kalā) form one bit (kāṣṭhā, 3.2 seconds). Thirty bits (kāṣṭhā) is one digit (kalā?, 1.6 minutes). Thirty digits (kalā) make up one section (muhūrta, 48 minutes) in human terms, O great Brahmin.

|1.20| Thirty sections (muhūrta) are known to the wise as night and day [i.e. a full day]. Thirty days and nights are taught by the wise to be one month.

|1.21| One year is twelve months [according to] people who know the entity of time. The time span of three hundred

|1.22| and sixty thousand years by human terms is said to be the Kali age (yuga). The Dvāpara age is known to be twice as long as the Kali age.

|1.23| The Tretā age is thrice [as long], the Kr̥ta age four [times as long as the Kali age]. This is the figure related to the four ages (yuga). Taking it seventy-one [times],

|1.24| the knowledge about one time-span of a Manu (manvantara) has been taught briefly. One aeon (kalpa) is fourteen manvantaras in total.

|1.25| Brahmā’s day (brahmāhar) is made up of ten thousand Kalpas. [Brahmā’s] night is of the same [duration] according to the wise who know the truth.

|1.26| When [Brahmā’s] night falls, the whole moving and unmoving universe dissolves. And when [his] daylight comes, the moving and unmoving [universe] is born.

|1.27| One para times parārdha [number of, i.e. two hundred quadrillion times a hundred quadrillion] kalpas have passed [so far], O great Brahmin. Bhr̥gu and the other sages say that the future is the same [time span].

|1.28| Just as the sun, the planets, the stars and the moon are percieved in this world as wandering around, the wheel of time (kālacakra) keeps spinning and we never experience its halting.

|1.29| Time creates living beings and time destroys them again. Everything is under the control of time. There is nothing that can bring time under control.

|1.30| Fourteen parārdha [fourteen hundred quadrillion] god kings, O Brahmin, have passed by over time, for time is difficult to overcome.

|1.31| Time is [manifest] as a great yogin, as Brahmā, Viṣṇu and supreme Śiva, is beginningless and endless, is the creator, the great soul. Pay homage [to Time].

The parārdha etc.: numbers

Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.32| I have just heard [the term] ‘wheel of time’ (kālacakra) uttered from [your] lotus mouth, as well as parārdha and para. You have made these things appear as exciting, as things to hear.

Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.33| One, ten, a hundred, a thousand, and ten thousand (ayuta), a hundred thousand (prayuta), a million (niyuta), ten million (koṭi), a hundred million (arbuda), and one billion (vr̥nda, 109),

|1.34| ten billion (kharva), a hundred billion (nikharva), one trillion (śaṅku, 1012), and ten trillion (padma), a hundred trillion (samudra), one quadrillion (madhya, 1015), ten quadrillion ([an]anta), a hundred quadrillion (parārdha), and two hundred quadrillion (para).

|1.35| Each should be known as powers of ten up to parārdha. The number corresponding to para is double that of parārdha.

|1.36| There is no higher number than para. This is my firm conviction, which is based on my readings of the Purāṇas and the Vedas and [which I have now] taught [to you], O great Brahmin.

Brahmā’s Egg

Vigatarāga spoke:

|1.37| How many eggs of Brahmā are there? And are its measurements available anywhere? From how many finger’s breadths high does the sun heat the earth?

Anarthayajña spoke:

|1.38| How could I enumerate [all] the eggs of Brahmā, O twice-born? Even the gods don’t know [all the details], not to mention humans.

|1.39| I shall teach [you], as far as I can, in due order and truthfully, that, O great Brahmin, which Mātariśvan was taught by Brahmā in the past.

|1.40| Ten names of all the [cosmic] rulers of each of the eight directions in Brahmā’s Egg, [which is] inside Śiva’s Egg, are being taught now, listen.

The names of the cosmic rulers

East

|1.41| [1] Sahā, [2] Asaha, [3] Saha, [4] Sahya, [5] Visaha, [6] Saṁhata, [7] Asabhā, [8] Prasaha, [9] Aprasaha, [10] Sānu: [these are] the ten Leaders in the East.

South-East

|1.42| [1] Prabhāsa, [2] Bhāsana, [3] Bhānu, [4] Pradyota, [5] Dyutima, [6] Dyuti, [7] Dīptatejas, [8] Tejas, [9] Tejā, [10] Tejavaho: [these are] the ten [rulers] in the direction of Agni [SE]. Now listen to [the names for] the Yama’s region, O twice-born.

South

|1.43| [1] Yama, [2] Yamunā, [3] Yāma, [4] Saṁyama, [5] Yamuna, [6] Ayama, [7] Saṁyana, [8] Yamanoyāna, [9] Yaniyugmā, [10] Yanoyana.

South-West

|1.44| [1] Nagaja, [2] Naganā, [3] Nanda, [4] Nagara, [5] Naga, [6] Nandana, [7] Nagarbha, [8] Gahana, [9] Guhyo, [10] Gūḍhaja: [these are] the ten associated with [the South-West].

West

|1.45| I shall teach you the [names] in Varuṇa’s region [in the west]. Listen, O Brahmin, learn from me. [1] Babhra, [2] Setu, [3] Bhava, [4] Udbhadra, [5] Prabhava, [6] Udbhava, [7] Bhājana, [8] Bharaṇa, [9] Bhuvana, and [10] Bhartr̥: these ten dwell in Varuṇa’s region [in the west].

North-West

|1.46| [1] Nr̥garbha, [2] Asuragarbha, [3] Devagarbha, [4] Mahīdhara, [5] Vr̥ṣabha, [6] Vr̥ṣagarbha, [7] Vr̥ṣāṅka, [8] Vr̥ṣabhadhvaja,

|1.47| and [9] Vr̥ṣaja and [10] Vr̥ṣanandana: these are to be known properly as the ten leaders in Vāyu’s region [in the north-west], as I taught them, O twice-born.

North

|1.48| [1] Sulabha, [2] Sumana, [3] Saumya, [4] Supraja, [5] Sutanu, [6] Śiva, [7] Sata, [8] Satya, [9] Laya, [10] Śambhu: [these are] the ten leaders in the north.

North-East

|1.49| [1] Indu, [2] Bindu, [3] Bhuva, [4] Vajra, [5] Varada, [6] Vara, [7] Varṣaṇa, [8] Ilana, [9] Valina, [10] Brahmā: [these are] the ten rulers in the Īśāna direction [i.e. in the north-east].

Center

|1.50| [1] Apara, [2] Vimala, [3] Moha, [4] Nirmala, [5] Mana, [6] Mohana, [7] Akṣaya, [8] Avyaya, [9] Viṣṇu, [10] Varada: [these are] the ten [leaders] in the centre.

Subordinates

|1.51| Each of the ten rulers has a retinue of a hundred subordinates. Each one of [these] hundred is surrounded by a thousand subordinates.

|1.52| Each one of the thousand is surrounded by ten thousand [subordinates], the ten thousand is surrounded by a multitude of a hundred thousand, the hundred thousand by a million,

|1.53| [that is] each one has a retinue of a million [subordinates] (niyuta). [Then those] are surrounded by ten million (koṭi) [subordinates], [they in turn] by a hundred million (daśakoṭi).

|1.54| Each one of the hundred million is surrounded by a billion (vr̥nda) subordinates (bhr̥ta). Each one in these groupsof a billion (vr̥nda) is surrounded by ten billion (kharva) [subordinates].

|1.55| Each in these gourps of ten billion (kharva) is surrounded by a hundred billion (daśakharva). Each of those hundred billion (daśakharva) is surrounded by a trillion (śaṅku) [deities].

|1.56| Each of those one trillion (śaṅku) is surrounded by ten trillion (padma). Each of those ten trillion (padma) is surrounded by a hundred trillion (samudra).

|1.57| And each of those hundred trillion (samudra) is surrounded by those whose number is one quadrillion (madhya). Each of those quadrillion (madhya) is surrounded by ten quadrillion (ananta).

|1.58| Each of those ten quadrillion (ananta) is surrounded by a hundred quadrillion (parārdha). Each of those hundred quadrillion (parārdha) is surrounded by two hundred quadrillion (para). This is how it is taught, O Brahmin. The enumeration [of the rulers of the Brahmāṇḍa] has been taught as much as it is possible.

Measurements

|1.59| Listen to me and learn about the measurements [of the universe], O Brahmin, I shall teach [you] in a concise manner. The body of the Egg is like that of [the moon] at moonrise on the day of the full moon.

|1.60| The whole circumference of the Eggs has been declared by Brahmā to be ten million (koṭi) times a thousand times ten million yojanas.

|1.61| The Sun shines from the height of seven thousand seven hundred and twenty koṭi finger’s breath.

|1.62| The numbers pertaining to the measurements have been taught in brief. The characteristics of the unmeasurable Brahmāṇḍa[s] have been taught.

The redactors (of the Purāṇas)

|1.63| O truest of the twice-born, the Purāṇa[s of] 8,000,000 [verses] were taught by [1] Brahmā to [2] Mātariśvan [= Vāyu] in their entirety, in their true form.

|1.64| Vāyu abridged the verses and then gave [the Purāṇas] to [3] Uśanas. He [Uśanas] also abridged the verses, and [4] Br̥haspati received them.

|1.65| Br̥haspati taught 30,000 [verses] to [5] Sūrya [the Sun]. Divākara [= the Sun] taught 25,000 [verses] to [6] Mr̥tyu [Death].

|1.66| Mr̥tyu taught 21,000 [verses] to [7] Indra. Indra taught 20,000 verses to [8] Vasiṣṭha.

|1.67| And he[, Vasiṣṭha taught] 18,000 [verses] to [9] Sārasvata. Sārasvata [taught] 17,000 [verses] to [10] Tridhāma[n].

|1.68| [He taught] 16,000 verses to [11] Bharadvāja. [Bharadvāja] taught 15,000 verses to [12] Trivr̥ṣa.

|1.69| [Trivr̥ṣa] then [taught] 14,000 verses to [13] Antarīkṣa. [Antarīkṣa] taught 13,000 [verses] to [14] Trayyāruṇi.

|1.70| Trayyāruṇi, the great Brahmin, having abridged them again, taught 12,000 [verses] to [15] Dhanaṁjaya.

|1.71| Dhanaṁjaya, the great sage, handed [them] over to [16] Kr̥taṁjaya. [That recension was transmitted] from Kr̥taṁjaya, O best of the twice-born, to [17] noble R̥ṇaṁjaya.

|1.72| Then from R̥ṇaṁjaya it was given to [18] Gautama, the great sage, from Gautama to [19] Bharadvāja, from him to [20] Haryātman.

|1.73| Then [21] Rājaśravas received it, then [22] Somaśuṣma. Then from Somaśuṣma [23] Tr̥ṇabindu received it, O twice-born.

|1.74| Tr̥ṇabindu taught it to [24] Vr̥kṣa, Vr̥kṣa to [25] Śakti [the father of Parāśara]. Śakti taught it to [26] Parāśara, then [Parāśara] to [27] Jatukarṇa.

|1.75| Jatukarṇa taught it to [28] [Vyāsa] Dvaipāyana, the great sage. Dvaipāyana, the great sage, gave it to [29] Romaharṣa.

|1.76| Romaharṣa taught the Purāṇa[s] of 12,000 [verses], now fully revealed, to his son, [30] Amitabuddhi, for the benefit of humankind. What else do you wish to know?

Here ends the first chapter in the Vr̥ṣasārasaṁgraha called the Description of the Brahmāṇḍa[s].






Chapter Two

Vigatarāga spoke:

|2.1| I have heard the description of the Brahmāṇḍa from [you,] the best of men, its extent, colour, form and the numbers associated with it, in a concise manner.

|2.2| You mentioned a Śivāṇḍa as taught to be the receptacle of the Brahmāṇḍa. What are its characteristics and how much is its extent?

|2.3| Whose dwelling place is it? And [what] is the scale of the one[s] who dwell there? What kind of people live there? And who is the ruler (prajāpati) there?

Summary of the Śivāṇḍa

Anarthayajña spoke:

|2.4| Please don’t ask me about the characteristics of the Śivāṇḍa, O Brahmin. How could even the gods have the power to really know and see [the Śivāṇḍa]?

|2.5| The path leading to it is not to be trodden, it is more secret than any secret, and it is lofty. There is no master or servant [lit. the opposite] there, nobody to be punished and no punisher.

|2.6| There are no truthful or untruthful people there, no moral or immoral people, no crooked people, no hypocrisy, no thirst or envy.

|2.7| There is no anger or desire there, no arrogance or discontent ([a]sūyaka), no envy or hatred, no cheaters and no jealousy.

|2.8| There is no disease, no aging, no grief and no agitation there, there are no inferior or superior people and there is nobody in-between.

|2.9| There are no privileged men or women there in Śiva’s abode, no reproach or praise, no selfish or treacherous people.

|2.10| There is no pride or arrogance there, no cruelty or trickery and so on. There are no beggars and no donors there.

|2.11| Go without material desires (anarthin), being there you’ll be resting under a wishing tree. There is no karma there and no enemy. No Kali age is there and there is no fighting.

|2.12| There is no Dvāpara age or Tretā or Kr̥ta. There are no manvantaras there and no kalpas.

|2.13| No universal floods of destruction come, and there are no days and nights of Brahmā. There is no birth and death there and one never encounters catastrophes.

|2.14| Nobody is tied to the noose of hope and there is no passion or delusion. There are no gods and demons there and no Yakṣas, Serpents and Rākṣasas.

|2.15| There are no Ghosts nor Piśācas, no Gandharvas and no R̥ṣis. There are no planets there, no Nāgas, Kiṁnaras or Garuḍa-like creatures.

|2.16| There are no recitations or daily rituals there, nobody performs the Agnihotra and there are no sacrificers. There are no religious observances and no austerities and no ‘animal hell’.

|2.17| Nobody would be able to tell the extent of the qualities of the god Īśāna’s powers, not even in a hundred years.

|2.18| All are born by Hara’s wish. I shall teach [them to] you one by one, excluding gods and people, starting with the trees, the bushes and creepers.

|2.19| The height [of the Śivāṇḍa] is two parārdhas, and [its] width is the same. There are lovely flowers of different forms [there] and also lovely fruits.

|2.20| There are also golden trees and also gem trees, coral gem thickets and ruby plants.

|2.21| There are tasty roots and fruits and trees with creepers on their twigs. All are shape-shifters and they fulfill man’s desires and they whisper seductively.

|2.22| There [in the Śivāṇḍa], O Brahmin, all the subjects are the oceans of endless virtues. They are all equally beautiful and strong, and they shine like millions of suns.

|2.23| [The Śivāṇḍa] is two parārdha long and two parārdha wide, and two parārdha yojanas is its extension, O great Brahmin.

|2.24| [Īśāna’s] powers cannot be expressed by numbers, neither can [His] powerfulness, O twice-born. [In fact, the extension in the Śivāṇḍa] downwards and upwards cannot be expressed by numbers, neiter can its horizontal extension.

|2.25| [In reality,] I do not know the length and width of the Śivāṇḍa. Enjoyment is undecaying there, and there is no birth or death there.

|2.26| In the centre of the Śivāṇḍa, [creatures] shine like cow’s milk. [It is] said to be the region (ālaya) of the one and a half para crore Īśānas.

|2.27| They are all like the rising sun in the region of Tatpuruṣa. They are one and a half para crore [in number], living in the east.

|2.28| Everybody is like collyrium in the southern direction, in the region of Aghora, one and a half para crore [in number].

|2.29| In the western direction, they are like jasmine, the moon, like snowy rocks. Sadyojāta’s lovely region is [home] to one and a half para crore [people].

|2.30| In the northern direction, they are like saffron in water. Vāmadeva’s region is [home] to one and a half para crore [people].

|2.31| Īśāna has five parts (kalā), [his Tatpuruṣa] face has four. Aghora has eight, and there are thirteen Vāmadeva[-kalā]s.

|2.32| Sadyojāta has eight parts. These parts, altogether thirty-eight, which liberate us from the ocean of existence, have been taught, O truest Brahmin.

|2.33| Those who explore the truth should know the numbers, the colours and directions associated with each one [of Śiva’s faces] in the way taught above.

|2.34| If one has the intention to go to the Śivāṇḍa, one should practise Śiva-yoga regularly. Without Śiva-yoga, O Brahmin, it is impossible to go there.

|2.35| [Even] by [performing] millions of sacrifices such as the Aśvamedha, or by performing all the difficult austerities for a hundred kalpas, it is impossible to get there even for the gods, O great ascetic.

|2.36| By [merely] bathing and performing austerities at all the sacred places such as the Gaṅgā, even the honorable R̥ṣis will not be able to get there.

|2.37| Or [even] by donating the oceans of the seven islands with all their gems to a Veda expert, O Brahmin, with faith and devotion, one will not be able to go there without meditation. [This is a] certainty.

|2.38| He who destroys his own body and gives it without hesitation to those who are in need of it, or he who gives away his wife, his son and his possessions or his own head to those in need, or he who [performs] other difficult deeds, will not be able to go there [by merely doing these].

|2.39| He who has completed the sacrifices, the pilgrimages, the austerities, the donations, the study of the Vedas, will experience those enjoyments that the Brahmāṇḍa offers, still being subject to time and death.

|2.40| Dharma decays tossed forward by time. Time flies moving everything round and round like a circle of burning coal. Time is called kāla because of the waves (kalana) of the three divisions of time [past, present, future].

Here ends the second chapter in the Vr̥ṣasārasaṁgraha called the Description of the Śivāṇḍa.






Chapter Three

An Exposition of Dharma

Vigatarāga spoke:

|3.1| Why do they call it Dharma? And how many embodiments (mūrti) is he known to have? He is known as a bull: how many legs does it/he have? How many are his paths?

|3.2| I have become curious [about these questions]. Put an end to my doubts for good. Whose son is [Dharma], O best of sages? How many children does he have?

Anarthayajña spoke:

|3.3| Well, dhr̥ti (‘firmness’) is [of the same] verbal root [as dharma], and is said to be [its] synonym. It is called dharma because it supports (āDHĀRaṇa) and because it is great (MAhattva).

|3.4| The four-legged Bull is the embodiment of both Śruti and Smr̥ti. It is Dharma, as made up of the four āśramas.

|3.5| And the paths of Dharma are five. Listen, O Brahmin: [existence as] gods, men, animals, [existence in] hell and [as] immovable things [such as plants and rocks] etc.

|3.6| Eternal Dharma was born after splitting Brahmā’s heart. He has beautiful wives, thirteen in number, with nice waists.

|3.7| They are Dakṣa’s daughters, [called] Śraddhā and so on. They have huge eyes and they are beautiful. Numerous sons and grandsons were born to him. This is the emergence of Dharma. What more do you wish to hear?

Vigatarāga spoke:

|3.8| I would like to hear about Dharma’s wives truly and about each one of the sons born to them. Teach me, O great ascetic.

Anarthayajña spoke:

|3.9| [Dharma’s wives are] [1] Śraddhā (‘Faith’), [2] Lakṣmī (‘Prosperity’), [3] Dhr̥ti (‘Resolution’), [4] Tuṣṭi (‘Satisfaction’), [5] Puṣṭi (‘Growth’), [6] Medhā (‘Wisdom’), [7] Kriyā (‘Labour’), [8] Lajjā (‘Modesty’), [9] Buddhi (‘Intelligence’), [10] Śānti (‘Tranquillity’), [11] Vapus (‘Beauty’), [12] Kīrti (‘Fame’), [13] Siddhi (‘Success’), [all] born to Prasūti [Dakṣa’s wife].

|3.10| Śraddhā’s son is Kāma (‘Desire’). Darpa (‘Pride’) is said to be Lakṣmī’s son. Dhr̥ti’s son is Niyama (‘Rule’). Saṁtoṣa (‘Satisfaction’) is Tuṣṭi’s son.

|3.11| To Puṣṭi was born a son [called] Lābha (‘Profit’). Medhā’s son is Śruta (‘Sacred Knowledge’). Kriyā’s sons are Daṇḍa (‘Punishment’) and Samaya (‘Law’).

|3.12| Lajjā’s son is Vinaya (‘Discipline’), Buddhi’s son is Bodha (‘Intelligence’). Lajjā has two [more] sons: Sudhiya[/Sudhī] (‘Wise’) and Apramāda (‘Cautiousness’).

|3.13| Kṣema (‘Peace’) is to be known as Śānti’s son, Vyavasāya (‘Resolution’) is Vapus’ son. Yaśas (‘Fame’) is Kīrti’s son, Sukha (‘Joy’) was born to Siddhi. [This is how] the sons of Dharma in the [manvantara] era of Svāyambhuva [Manu] were known.

Vigatarāga spoke:

|3.14| How come Dharma has two embodiments? Tell me, O great ascetic. I am extremely intrigued. Cut my doubts concerning [this] knowledge.

Anarthayajña spoke:

|3.15| Dharma’s embodiment is said to consist of Śruti and Smr̥ti. The characteristics of the Śrauta [tradition] are an association with a wife [i.e. marriage] and with the fire ritual, and sacrifice. The Smārta [tradition] [focuses on] the conduct (ācāra) of the classes (varṇa) and life-stages (āśrama) which is connected to rules and regulations (yama-niyama).

Yama and Niyama rules

|3.16| Now hear the classification of both the yama and niyama rules. Non-violence, truthfulness, not stealing, absence of hostility, self-restraint, taboos, virtue, carefulness, charm, honesty: these are the ten yamas.

|3.17| The wise say that there are five subclasses to each. I shall teach you about non-violence and the other [yama-rules]. Listen carefully, O twice-born.

The first yama-rule: Non-violence

Five types of violence

|3.18| Frightening and beating [other people], tying [someone] up, killing and the destruction of [other people’s] livelihood: violence is said by the wise who see the truth to be of [these] five types.

|3.19| Cruel people beat [other people] with sticks, clods of earth [understand: they stone them], with whips and other [objects] in the everyday world. Their bodies broken by the same blows, they receive the capital punishment.

|3.20| [Others,] tie up [people] at their feet and their arms and chests. [These,] hung by their hair and neck, die in this way without being wounded. This is the capital punishment for tying up [other people].

|3.21| He who frightens [other people] with the terrible danger of enemies and thieves, with lions, tigers, elephants or snakes, or by other horrors, will be executed.

|3.22| He who robs somebody’s money is to be punished by the same person. He is [to be] struck down by those whose livelihood got damaged by him.

|3.23| [Those who kill other people] with poison, fire, arrows, swords, or by the force of magic or yoga are called murderers by the sages who see the truth, O great Brahmin.

Praise of non-violence

|3.24| Non-violence is the highest Dharma. He who abandons it is a wicked person. It is free of pain and trouble, it yields the fruits of all [other] Dharmic teachings [in itself].

|3.25| There isn’t a bigger fool than he [who abandons it]. There is no bigger mental darkness [than the abandonment of non-violence]. There is no greater suffering or greater infamy.

|3.26| There is no greater sin or a more effective poison. There is no greater ignorance, there is nothing worse, O great ascetic.

|3.27| He who does not harm the four types of living beings beginning with plants is the best person, having compassion for all creatures.

|3.28| He who always has compassion for all creatures is the [true] Pandit. He is the [true] sacrificer, the [true] ascetic, he is the donor, the one with a firm vow.

|3.29| Non-violence is the supreme pilgrimage place. Non-violence is the highest austerity. Non-violence is the highest donation. Non-violence is the highest joy.

|3.30| Non-violence is the supreme sacrifice. Non-violence is the supreme religious observance. Non-violence is supreme knowledge. Non-violence is the supreme ritual.

|3.31| Non-violence is the highest purity. Non-violence is the highest self-restraint. Non-violence is the highest profit. Non-violence is the greatest fame.

|3.32| Non-violence is the supreme Dharma. Non-violence is the supreme path. Non-violence is the supreme Brahman. Non-violence is supreme Śiva.

On meet-consumption

|3.33| One should refrain from meat-consumption. One should not even desire it mentally. He who abandons meat will receive a great reward.

|3.34| He who wishes to nourish his own flesh with the flesh of other [beings], outside of worshipping the ancestors and the gods, is the biggest sinner of all.

|3.35| During the madhuparka offering and during a sacrifice, during rituals for the ancestors and the gods: only in these cases are animals to be slaughtered and not in any other case. [This is what] Manu taught.

|3.36| Should he buy it or procure it himself or should it be offered by others, if he eats meat, he will not sin if he first worships the gods and the ancestors.

|3.37| [People who know] the Vedas and [perform] sacrifices and austerities and [visit] sacred places, donate, [are of] good conduct, [perform] rituals and [keep] religious vows [but eat meat] will not [be able to] enjoy even a tiny portion of [such rewards that] [those] people [receive] who have given up meat.

|3.38| The deer and the goats, the sheep, the cows and other [animals] wander in the world happily and in great strength [just] from eating leaves and grass.

|3.39| Monkeys eat fruits, Rākṣasas prefer blood. The fruit-eating monkeys defeated all the Rākṣasas.

|3.40| Therefore one should not crave meat in the hope of gaining strength, O Brahmin, in order to be able to draw a bow with force, or out of fear of the danger coming from the enemy.

|3.41| By wishing to make donations and perform sacrifices no one will become comparable to someone who refrains from violence. [He will have] fame and glory in this world and the supreme path in the other.

|3.42| A person who refrains from violence will gain, no doubt about it, the [same] meritorious rewards that others would get by donating the three worlds filled with jewels and gems in their entirety to an excellent Brahmin, by [performing] a thousand [times] ten trillion (padma) [times] ten thousand (ayuta) koṭīyajña sacrifices, by donating the earth [to a priest] as sacrificial fee, and by bathing [at] a thousand times ten million times a million (niyuta) sacred places at once.

Here ends the third chapter in the Vr̥ṣasārasaṁgraha called the Praise of Non-violence.






Chapter Four

The second yama-rule: Truthfulness

Anarthayajña spoke:

|4.1| The state of being real (sad-bhāva) is called truth (sat-ya). Alternatively, it is also a certainty (pratyaya) that originates in perception (dr̥ṣṭa). Relating things in a way that corresponds to reality is called ‘speaking the truth.’

|4.2| He who endures severe abuse and beating etc. but keeps quiet, his self being conquered, is said to be [an example of] truth[fulness].

|4.3| If one is being interrogated at any time with a sword lifted to strike him down, in this case the truth is not to be spoken, and a lie is can be called truth.

|4.4| A person who is walking on the road and is afraid of being killed rify should not reply [to people who are potentially dangerous] even if they ask him. This is also called truth[fulness].

|4.5| A lie does not hurt when it is connected with joking, with women, O king, at the time of marriage, at the departure from life and when one’s entire wealth is about to be taken away. They call these five kinds of lies truths.

|4.6| Since truth is the supreme Dharma in [the world of] gods, humans and animals, truth is the best, the most preferable. Truth is the eternal Dharma.

|4.7| Truth is an unmanifest ocean. Truth yields imperishable pleasures. Truth is the ship that carries you to the other world. Truth is the wide path.

|4.8| Truth is said to be the desired path. Truth is the supreme sacrifice. Truth is a pilgrimage place, a supreme pilgrimage place. Truth is an endless donation.

|4.9| Truth is morality, austerity, knowledge. Truth is purity, self-control and tranquillity. Truth is the ladder upwards. Truth is fame and glory and happiness.

|4.10| [When] a thousand Aśvamedha sacrifices and truth are measured on a pair of scales, truth indeed surpasses a thousand Aśvamedha sacrifices.

|4.11| The Sun shines because of truth. The Earth stays in place by truth. The winds blow because of truth. Water is cooling through truth.

|4.12| The oceans exist by the truthful encounter with Priyavrata. Govinda abides in truth because He [as Vāmana] stopped [Mahā]Bali [in spite of the fact that this was achieved by a trick].

|4.13| Fire burns with truth. The Moon rises by truth. It is because of truth that the Vindhya mountain stands in place and that although is was growing it is not growing [anymore].

|4.14| The [mythical] Lokāloka mountains are located in truth. Mount Meru stands by truth. The Vedas abide in truth. Dharma is rooted in truth.

|4.15| The milk a cow yields is truth. Ghee in milk is present as truth. The soul dwells in the body in truth. The eternal soul is truth.

|4.16| If truth is obtained by somebody (ekena), he/she will be one for whom Dharma is surely accomplished. By the heroism of Rāma Rāghava, the only truth was well-guarded.

|4.17| Thus have [I] taught the rules of truth to you, O virtuous one, to favour the whole world. What else do you wish to hear?

The third yama-rule: Refraining from stealing

Vigatarāga spoke:

|4.18| I can’t have enough of learning about [this teaching of] your[s on] Dharma. Teach me further than this, O great ascetic.

Anarthayajña spoke:

|4.19| Now listen to [my teaching about] stealing, O great Brahmin, which is taught to be of five kinds. Firstly, [listen to] theft , then bribery, cheating with weights, cheating with scales, and the fifth kind, robbery.

|4.20| When somebody’s wealth is taken away by an impudent and wicked person is called theft. It is a foolish thought even if suppressed.

|4.21| O great Brahmin, listen to bribery, which defiles Dharma. A sum of money taken in order to exempt somebody from a duty is a bribe. Therefore this [also] should be considered as such [i.e. as stealing because] it is committed out of greed for material goods.

|4.22| [Even if] somebody wants to protect a family by the method of cheating with weights, that person should be considered a thief, because he takes away other people’s wealth.
